Students in Project STEPP, housed at ECU, remain in college at rates that exceed the general university population. STEPP aims for graduation rates of participants with learning disabilities to match or exceed the six-year graduation rate of the university.

To provide high-quality services to children and families of East Durham, North Carolina. East Durham Children's Initiative focuses on the following priorities: increasing out-of-school learning opportunities for youth; developing middle and high school programming; exploring opportunities to scale services; and creating anew service delivery model that will increase its reach while providing individualised academic and social-emotional supports for youth.

To support East Europe Foundation (EEF) Moldovato strengthen civil society organisations, groups and movements that are working to end violence against women and children in Moldova. EEF partners with Oak Foundations Issues Affecting Women and Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Programmes by facilitating its grant-making to grassroots women organisations, providing services to victims of domestic violence and working to change norms related to family violence.

To support the efforts of ECPAT International in ending the sexual exploitation of children around the world. This includes children trafficked for sexual purposes, and children sexually exploited through prostitution, in the travel and tourism sectors, and online. ECPAT and its global network of 104 members in 93 countries work collaboratively with partners and stakeholders at the global, regional and national levels to ensure that children everywhere enjoy their fundamental rights, and are protected from all forms of sexual exploitation.

To learn from educators how instructional materials (e.g., text books and other curricula) can be designed better to support the needs of diverse learners. It will also create an advisory panel of experts and organise a convening to inform revisions to EdReports tools and processes.

To strengthen the educational skills of parents and early childhood professionals in the French-speaking part of Switzerland on educating small children on sexuality. This will be done through workshops, a parent and child cafeÌ
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: To provide core support to ENV to implement its strategic plan. ENV focuses on the conservation of nature and the protection of wildlife. ENV works to raise public awareness, reduce demand for wildlife trade products, strengthen policy and legislation, and directly supports enforcement efforts in the protection of endangered species of regional, national, and global significance.

To support Education NC in engaging teachers across North Carolina in leadership and learning that focus on the connection between equity and learning differences. Education NC will elevate stories from students, families and communities on topics related to learning differences, special education and/or learner variability.

To provide bilingual and culturally informed behavioural health treatment for under-served Spanish speaking individuals and families in North Carolina, US. El Futuro does this by providing: (1) high impact (evidence based) clinical services; (2) training for professionals who work with this population; and (3) prevention, education and outreach in the community.

To help Latinx people to achieve positive social change by building consciousness, capacity and community action in North Carolina, the United States. El Pueblo seeks to create a just and equitable community where all people are respected, valued and engaged.

To provide core support to Elas Social Investment Fund, enabling it to make progress towards its key strategic priorities to strengthen Brazilian women's movements. It will also use the core funds to strengthen its own institutional practices. Elas is the first and only fund in Brazil focused exclusively on supporting women's rights organisations. Its grant-making is concentrated on five priority areas: sexual autonomy; ending violence against women; care among activists; gender equality in education; and strengthening feminist movements.

To ensure the survival of elephants and their habitats and to promote harmonious co-existence between humans and elephants. Elephants Alive works to: provide science-based information to secure the survival of elephants within intact ecosystems; create awareness of the plight of elephants at a time when populations are being decimated across Africa; and captures hearts and minds through research, education, advocacy and networking both locally and internationally.

To advance elephant conservation in Botswana and beyond. This will be done by helping to build upon the strong sense of national pride for wildlife conservation in Botswana and by creating an effective framework for combatting the illegal trade in wildlife. Elephants without Borders works to conserve wildlife and natural resources through: innovative research; education; and information sharing.

To work towards the elimination of mother-to-child transmission of HIV. The Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation will provide care and treatment services to HIV-positive mothers and reduce HIV/AIDS-related illness and death among women and children, so that more children will be born free of HIV and live healthy lives.

To provide support to the Ellen MacArthur Foundation to deliver the New Plastics Economy initiative. The project will catalyse action across the business and philanthropic communities, complementing other initiatives that deliver social impact and stimulating systemic change at a global scale.

To use a two-generation approach to support literacy and English language development among parents and children in a school district and university partnership. Through its popular afterschool project, Elon University's, â€˜It Takes a Village, seeks to increase reading proficiency of at-risk students in five Title I schools in the Alamance-Burlington School System.â€

To provide core support to the African Movement of Child and Youth Workers (AMWCY), which supports child workers in Africa. Among other things, the AMWCY supports children who find themselves in prison, provides healthcare to working children, and improves the living and working conditions of children and youth.

To reduce carbon and air emissions in China by improving urban planning and air quality management. This will be done with integrated methods, policy and modelling tools which will be promoted for use by other organisations and cities. The Energy Foundation works to promote the transition to a sustainable energy future by advancing energy efficiency and renewable energy.

To accelerate change towards low-carbon energy systems in India that enable robust economic development and limit the rise in global temperature to well below 2°C. This will be done by facilitating pathways to low-carbon energy systems.

To support ESCA Cancer Supports mission to positively impact the lives of those affected by cancer. It will provide emotional support, practical help and information in English to patients and their families and carers in Geneva and Vaud in Switzerland and in regions in neighbouring France. ESCA CSs vision is to serve clients in a friendly environment, to be supportive, non-judgemental and confidential, and to become well integrated in the regions medical and cancer support community.

To assist in the disruption of major criminal syndicates trafficking ivory and encourage a more effective criminal justice response to the illegal ivory trade. This will be done across a range of national and intergovernmental enforcement agencies and non-traditional actors such as Financial Intelligence Units.

To end Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated (IUU) fishing and build sustainable, equitable and legal fisheries in West Africa. The Environmental Justice Foundation works to secure a world where natural habitats and environments can sustain, and be sustained by, the communities that depend upon them for their basic needs and livelihoods.

To assist the Environmental Justice Foundation and collaborators in Taiwan and Korea to harness political opportunities to create positive change on labour policy and illegal, unregulated and unreported fishing. The Environmental Justice Foundation works internationally to protect the environment and defend human rights.

To provide core support to the EJF, based in the UK in building up its organisational, investigative and communications capacity internationally. EJF works to protect the worlds seas and oceans by: exposing illegal fishing and exploitation; highlighting the dangers of toxic pesticides and promoting viable organic alternatives; and exposing the impacts of our changing global climate on the most vulnerable people on the planet. The EJF works internationally to protect the environment and defend human rights.

To develop and disseminate a law and governance toolkit that provides governments and leaders of small scale fisheries with a range of regulatory tools and approaches that they can use to reform and strengthen their domestic laws. ELIs Mission is to foster innovative, just and practical law and policy solutions to enable leaders across borders and sectors to make environmental, economic and social progress.

To contribute to improving the quality of life of migrants in Geneva by providing information about the health and social services that they are entitled to access. Through discussions, information sessions, drop-in advice sessions and cultural and physical activities, Permanences Volantes offers services that are complementary to those provided by institutions.

To ensure that adolescent girls Tanzania and Zambia are free from sexual violence in schools, and to ensure access to justice for survivors and a right to education. In both countries the project will contribute to ensuring that adolescent girls enjoy their right to education in an environment that is safe and free from sexual violence and discrimination.

To provide core support to Escola de Ativismo and strengthen groups working to defend democracy, sustainability and human rights. This will be done by providing learning on strategies and techniques for nonviolent action, campaigns and mobilisation. This grant will also give a particular focus to the political incidence and strategic vision of activist groups in the Recife Metropolitan Region working to defend mobility, women's rights and sustainability.

To further develop the EU-Russia Civil Society Forum as a unique platform that brings together not-for-profit organisations from post-Soviet countries and the EU. Together, they work on projects, research and advocacy, dialogue with decision-makers and people-to-people exchange.

Organisation: European Center for Constitutional and Human Rights
Purpose: To hold perpetrators of serious human abuses to account through conventional or innovative legal means with a view to deterring future abuse, providing justice and redress to those affected and developing the international legal framework against impunity. Based in Berlin, ECCHR works with partners around the world on international crimes and accountability and business and human rights, and runs a significant training programme for young lawyers.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Organisation: European Center for Not for Profit Law
Purpose: To work with partners to empower civil society organisations to counter attacks on their operating space and freedom of association, assembly and expression, inspired by counter-terrorist financing and anti-money laundering (CTF/AML) policies, including those related to the Financial Action Task Force (FATF). ECNL will work to build expertise and produce guidelines around standards for CSOs to deploy at country level, and seek to improve CTF/AML global policy and processes so that they are both effective and rights-respecting.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To develop a South East Asian campaign to help countries meet their Paris climate targets. The European Climate Foundation was established in 2008 as a major philanthropic initiative to help Europe foster the development of a low-carbon society and play an even stronger international leadership role to mitigate climate change.

To enable effective communications and outreach around clean energy transitions for a safer future. The grant aims to raise awareness via strategic campaigns and media of the need for a clean energy future.

To develop a South East Asian campaign to help countries meet their Paris climate targets. The European Climate Foundation was established in 2008 as a major philanthropic initiative to help Europe foster the development of a low-carbon society and play an even stronger international leadership role to mitigate climate change.

To support the European Climate Foundations mission to build European leadership on decarbonisation to secure a cleaner, safer and healthier future. The European Climate Foundation was established in 2008 as a major philanthropic initiative to help Europe foster the development of a low-carbon society and play an even stronger international leadership role to mitigate climate change.

To develop a European and South East Asian campaign to help countries meet their Paris climate targets. The European Climate Foundation was established in 2008 as a major philanthropic initiative to help Europe foster the development of a low-carbon society and play an even stronger international leadership role to mitigate climate change.

To provide core support to the ECF, which works to develop a low-carbon society and mitigate the effects of climate change. Following the Paris Agreement last year, a new era of climate action is beginning in a bid to keep average temperatures well below 2 degrees Celsius.

Organisation: European Council on Refugees and Exiles
Purpose: To support the work of the ECRE, a network of over 90 non-governmental organisations in 38 European countries working to protect and advance the rights of refugees, asylum seekers and displaced persons. All ECREs member organisations work on behalf of refugees and/or promote a humane asylum policy in European policies and practice.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Organisation: European Federation for Transport and Environment T&E
Purpose: To accelerate the transition from heavily polluting vehicles to clean vehicles in Europe. This will be done by supporting the EU to adopt strong 2025 CO2 emissions standards for cars, vans and trucks. The goal is to increase the supply of zero-emission vehicles that reduce emissions.

To provide core support to the EFC, which aims to be the voice of institutional philanthropy in Europe and to serve as a centre of sector knowledge and exchange. This grant will focus on membership development and investment in information technology tools for sharing member profile data.

To administer a merit-based paid internship programme within Oaks International Human Rights programme; to expose recent graduates to the international human rights sector and give them direct experience in grant-making.

To provide core support to European Human Rights Advocacy Centre to challenge impunity for human rights violations by building the capacity of lawyers in Russia, Ukraine and the South Caucasus to litigate strategic cases before the European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR) and other international bodies.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Purpose: To provide core support to strengthen the ability of civil society to advocate for better implementation of judgements of the European Court of Human Rights. The EIN is a new network of European activists seeking to improve the functioning of the European system of human rights.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Organisation: European Network for the Work with Perpetrators of Domestic Violence
Purpose: To provide core support to the European Network for the Work with Perpetrators of Domestic Violence to improve the safety of women and their children at risk from violence. The Network does this by working with those that perpetrate violence, mainly men, helping them understand impacts and consequences of violence on their partners and children, fostering empathy, accountability and motivation to change.

To support ENS, a civil society alliance of non-governmental organisations, academic initiatives and individual experts, to ensure that stateless persons can secure adequate protection. ENS is dedicated to strengthening the often unheard voices of stateless persons in Europe, and to advocating for their human rights. It does this by conducting and supporting legal and policy development, awareness raising and capacity building activities.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To provide core support to Everyman Project in the UK by supporting men who perpetrate intimate partner violence to take responsibility for their actions and change. Everyman does this through the provision of counselling for men and through partner support services to women affected by violence. Everyman Project is based in London and has been delivering counselling programme for men who want to take responsibility for their actions and change their abusive behaviour for over 20 years.

To support Ex Cathedra, a leading UK choir, to deliver Singing Medicine - a programme which aims to improve the well-being of children at Birmingham Children's Hospital through positive and inclusive interactive songs and singing games.

Organisation: Exchange Clubs Child Abuse Prevention Center in Durham, Inc, DBA Exchange Family Center
Purpose: To strengthen families and prevent child abuse and neglect through family support, counselling and education. Exchange Family Center offers in-home parent coaching, works with teachers in preschools, provides trainings and collaborates with community partners to meet the needs of children and families in Durham, North Carolina.

To provide core support to Eye to Eye, a US-based mentoring organisation that pairs young adults who have learning disabilities and/or attention deficit disorders with middle school students who also have these learning differences. Eye to Eye uses an arts-based curriculum to build self-knowledge and self-esteem among both its mentees and mentors. It supports mentors in sharing their stories with others, becoming leaders and contributing to changing cultural perceptions of individuals with learning differences.

To promote and protect the fundamental rights of people facing criminal charges around the world, with a particular focus on Europe. Fair Trials works to ensure that fair trial rights are respected by: helping people to understand and exercise their fair trial rights; building a network of fair trial defenders; and fighting the underlying causes of injustice through research, policy and campaigning.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To reduce the prevalence of HIV/AIDS and mitigate its impact by empowering communities to better respond to the pandemic. At the same time this project will invest in training communities, raising awareness and promoting community ownership.

To improve the quality of life of people affected by HIV and AIDS in Makoni District of Manicaland Province and Marondera, Mrewa, Mutoko and Mudzi Districts of Mashonal and East Province. This grant will also support communities to initiate, implement and nurture sustainable holistic care programmes.

Organisation: Fana Association for Individuals with Learning and Communication Difficulties
Purpose: To provide core support to FAILCD, an organisation based in Ethiopia that provides training to educators and clinical services to children with learning differences such as dyslexia. FAILCD is based in the capital Addis Ababa and provides services throughout the country.

Organisation: Federação de Órgãos para Assistência Sociale Educacional (FASE)
Purpose: To support FASE to develop policies and support for participation of youth at the Youth Policy Forum and to participate, develop and implement ‘rights to the city’ policies in Brazil.

To provide core support for the leadership development programme in the First Alaskans Institute. This grant will also work to foster and grow traditional values of reciprocity and sharing, honouring elders and promoting the stewardship of land and resources. It aims to give back to Alaska Native communities through public policy fellowships, summer internships and youth and elder gatherings.

To support the Special Education Leader Fellowship (SELF) programme to provide ongoing leadership training, capacity building and technical assistance to educators and schools across New Orleans and beyond. These focus on developing educator and school capacity to promote the academic and social-emotional outcomes of students with learning differences. This grant will also support SELF to expand its service provision.

To provide core support to FLEX, based in the UK, to enable it to make progress on its core mission of ending human trafficking for labour exploitation. This will be done by: improving enforcement of labour rights standards in national and international trafficking responses; increasing recognition of victims of trafficking as individuals and rights-bearers; challenging policies, attitudes and practices that drive labour exploitation; and ensuring that FLEX is institutionally stronger and better able to serve the interests of actual and potential victims of trafficking for labour exploitation.

To support Fondation des Fondateurs, the intermediary through which a number of foundations support a collaborative called Funders for Fair Trade (FFT). FFT seeks to support a rigorous, informed and coordinated challenge to TTIP-style trade agreements across a strategic set of sectors and nations. FFT seeks to ensure that trade agreements that negatively impact core EU values of democracy, environmental protection, public health and human rights are not implemented.

To scale up efforts to sustainably secure fishing resources and conserve marine biodiversity in Mozambique. This re-granting partnership with Fondation Ensemble will: replicate communities fisheries management and conservation best practices; and reinforce coordination among partners. Fondation Ensemble is a Paris-based foundation with previous grant-making experience in Mozambique.

To support Fondation Partages core mission to collect and sort unsold stock from Geneva's food stores and to distribute it free of charge to associations and social services which assist and provide for those in need. Through its work, Partage fights against food waste and supports professional rehabilitation.

To support Pro Juventute to develop Swiss national standards for child safeguarding for the leisure and sport associations. This grant will also prepare a strategy to promote the helpline service for parents in Switzerland. Pro Juventute is an independent foundation that works to support youth.
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: To provide core support to Fondation ReÌ

The wish is to establish a secretariat which, with help from The Danish Foundation of Social Responsibility, a control group and a think tank will set a 100% focus on psychological violence. It is wanted to create a higher knowledge about psychological violence and move the development in the area against less acceptance of this scary problem, better legislation, better information (public education) and courage among the civilians to act when they see or hear about the problem as well as a better and broader cooperation between the area players. The aim is to prevent all the tragic consequences of psychological violence both compared to the individuals and families and including death.

Fonden for Socialt Ansvar (FSA) creates communities where they take care of each other and improves life for vulnerable groups for the benefit for the society. Oak Foundation Denmark is applied for 3-year support for strengthening FSA as an initiator for innovation and community.

The Mothers Aid wishes to offer a coordinated, holistic programme for young pregnant mothers. A programme that seeks to give the young mothers the ability to give their children a good and safe upbringing and self-employment through parenting skills, coping strategies, network, training and jobs. The main goal of the programme is the following: To sustain their parenting skills, To sustain their social network,To clarify their training and job abilities or to maintain their training and job abilities, To sustain their ability to exploit their possibilities. The fathers/partners will be included in the programme as much as possible.

To support the IAWPs Guatemala portfolio of grants working on trafficking and exploitation, with a focus on migration, labour rights and access to justice for victims of sexual violence during Guatemalas 30-year civil war. FCAMs support will help these organisations and networks to become stronger and more financially secure. It will also facilitate networking opportunities for partners in Guatemala and within the broader Central American region. As part of its movement-building efforts, FCAM will also engage across sectors and with other donors to bring greater visibility to the issues supported through this portfolio.

To provide FCAM with core support, strengthening its recognition as a leading feminist fund that builds women's and feminist movements in Central America. Oak support will also enable FCAM to contribute to the increased recognition of women's labour rights and improvement of working conditions in Guatemala's maquila and domestic sectors.

To provide core support to FFC to enable it to offer technical and financial assistance to grassroots organisations promoting and protecting the rights of women and girls in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. This grant will also advocate for a change in the status of women in society, for the restoration of peace and to strengthen the women's movement. FFC works to help mobilise financial resources to support women's grassroots organisations, networks and groups, and to build their capacity.

To reduce the vulnerability of young children to violence and abuse within the family and in care settings that make up part of the public healthcare system in Bulgaria. The project includes nationwide research and the introduction of pilot services, as well as the development and the adoption by the Council of Ministers of an early childhood development policy that is family-oriented and based on child rights principles.

To provide capacity building support for Alaska Native Organisations (ANOs) by offering organisational development tools and strategies. This grant will also support the completion of a state wide assessment of Alaska Native not-for profit organisations. The Foraker Group is dedicated to producing a healthy, sustainable not-for-profit sector in Alaska.

To prevent and remedy human rights violations in Myanmar and neighbouring states. This will be done by investigating abuses, highlighting findings and providing technical support to strengthen organisations and communities advocating for change. Fortify Rights seeks to achieve human rights-based solutions, influence decision-makers and support local responses to end abuses.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To establish a new student hall of residence for single parents, thus creating a safe, stable, and stimulating everyday life for the single parent and their children while they pursue an education. The new student hall of residence will support and promote the educational endeavours and support a sound family life for vulnerable families.

To provide core support to the London-based organisation Foundation for Change which helps people from disadvantaged backgrounds. This support will help those who have experienced addiction to drugs or alcohol achieve positive and enduring changes in their lives and to fully participate in society.

Organisation: Foundation for the Rights of Disadvantaged Populations (FRDP)
Purpose: To advance the rights of refugees and other people in need of protection in Asia-Pacific through capacity building, joint-advocacy and knowledge sharing. APRRN is a network of over 350 civil society organisations covering 28 countries. It works collectively to exert influence as a regional stakeholder in relevant policy dialogues, builds the capacity of national members and engages in advocacy to address asylum practice, immigration detention, statelessness, ill-treatment and other issues undermining the rights of refugees and vulnerable migrants.

To provide core support for FIZs Makasianti-trafficking programme. This will be done by: supporting victims of trafficking with legal and psychological counselling and shelter; training law enforcement and social services staff; advocating to improve the legal framework and ensure publicly financed support services; and building coalitions with other Swiss, European and International anti-trafficking organisations. FIZ is the oldest specialised anti-trafficking organisation in the German-speaking region of Switzerland.

Organisation: Frederiksberg Hospital, H:S - The Parker Institute
Purpose: To provide core support to the Parker Institute at Frederiksberg and Bispebjerg Hospital in Denmark. This will enable the Institute to conduct research on the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of musculoskeletal disorders, including osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis and fibromyalgia. The Parker Institute is an independent clinical research Institute which collaborates with the Department of Rheumatology at Frederiksberg and Bispebjerg Hospital.

To provide core funding to the Free Yezidi Foundation which delivers holistic care to Yezidi women and children that are survivors of ISIS violence in Iraq. In addition, Free Yezidi Foundation works to: secure justice for Yezidi survivors in national courts and tribunals; advocate for justice for Yezidi survivors and liberation of women and children still held by ISIS and raise awareness and advocate for ethical, sustainable, community-led and women-led responses for Yezidi survivors. Free Yezidi Foundation is a civil society organisation operating in Iraq.

To provide core support to FRIDA - The Young Feminist Fund, based in Canada. This grant will enable it to fund newly established young feminist-led initiatives. These initiatives pursue participatory grant-making processes that put funding decisions into the hands of applicants. FRIDA strengthens the capacity of young feminist organisations to: leverage additional resources for their work; enhance their leadership and impact; and increase commitments of donors and allies to resourcing young feminist activism.

To develop, implement and evaluate tools and resources that build educator knowledge and capacity to better meet the needs of students who learn differently. This will include online courses, micro-credentials and in-person convening.

The purpose of this application is to establish a new "Pinden" which is still perceived as the user's own sanctuary with wide possibilities for the activities that the users themselves choose and are responsible for. The "Pinden" must have sufficient space for the individual and a physical construction that confines mutual conflicts. In addition, the climate must be in good health and the facilities cater for the working environment of staff and volunteers.

To provide direct assistance to human rights defenders at risk worldwide. This will be done through: a 24/7 emergency support service (relocation, legal and medical emergency grants); capacity building to improve defenders security (personal/organisational and digital security workshops at local and regional levels, networking, including through Dublin Platform convening); international advocacy; and visibility.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To support Fund for Global Human Right efforts to: build a broad support constituency; deploy targeted and strategic communications to improve human rights messaging; and develop an institutional infrastructure to diversify and grow a broad revenue base.

To support FGHR to assist three local organisations in West Bengal to build strong communities that are free from marginalisation, violence and harassment. With deep knowledge of the regions they work in, the Fund seeks to support grassroots activists around the world.

Organisation: Fund for the City of New York
Purpose: To ensure the effective implementation of the new Right to Counsel legislation in New York City through outreach, education and tenant organising, as well as training for attorneys, and supporting other cities to campaign for the same. The Right to Counsel Coalition was established in 2014 to fight for this right and will now work to ensure it fulfils its intended purpose.

Fundamentet wants to rethink drop-in centres in such a way that focus is on making a positive change in your life more so than it being a place to park vulnerable people. A part of what they do in The Foundation is having the same function as a drop-in center. Fundamentet want this function and the people who use it to focus mainly on positive changes in peoples lives.

To catalyse EU member states compliance with the Common Fisheries Policy in order to ensure its full implementation. Funding FISH is a grant makers collaborative dedicated to achieving sustainable fisheries in Europe.

To support Funding Fish with two endeavours - a campaign focused on implementing the Common Fisheries Policy in the EU, and a research and policy project to understand the complexities of fisheries access agreements between the EU and coastal states. Funding Fish is a grant-makers collaborative dedicated to achieving sustainable fisheries in Europe.

To enable Fundo Socioambiental CASA to provide capacity building support to AÃ§Ã£o ComunitÃ¡ria Caranguejo UÃ§a to further its work in building a fair and equal society which contributes positively to people and communities. CASA Socio-Environmental Fund is a not-for-profit grant-making institution that mobilises and channels financial and capacity-building support to social and environmental initiatives and community based groups in South America.
To support 150 projects working on issues related to land management, urban rights, the right to the city, urban mobility, social participation and food security in Recife.

Expanding and consolidating the work of the Danish Food Bank by establishing a local branch in Kolding to be able to serve most of Region Syddanmark in order to reach socially disadvantaged people in a greater part of Denmark. The Kolding branch will also be working together with the municipality of Kolding and Jobcentre Kolding in order to develop a program to improve the job prospects of socially disadvantaged people by completing a mentee-program in the Food Bank where they work closely with volunteers - mostly storage work and delivering surplus food.

Organisation: Gabinete de Assessoria Juridica as Organizacoes Populares (GAJOP)
Purpose: To provide core support to improve citizen security in both the public and private sphere, as well as to implement a revised five-year strategic plan.

To develop alternative models for homeless shelters in New York City to improve both the physical environment and the programme effectiveness of transitional housing. This will make a measurable, positive impact on residents long-term life outcomes. Gateway Housing is an organisation based in New York City.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To affirm and promote women's rights and gender equality in Plovdiv, Bulgaria and more widely in the country, by providing rights-based services to women victims of violence. This support includes counselling, legal representation and strategic litigation. GAF provides quality legal services to women victims of violence in Bulgaria.

To provide capacity building support to our partners in Jharkhand to help create a strong civil society and a legacy of strong local organisations that represent the needs of ordinary people. Gender at Work partners with activists and researchers to transform structures of inequality and discriminatory social norms in organisations and communities. Gender at Work India brings gender equality experts from diverse sectors to work together.

To expand Generation Rents campaigns in London and nationally, with a focus on combating â€˜no fault evictions, limiting rent rises, improving security of tenure and supporting renters to exercise their rights against criminal landlords. Generation Rent provides a national voice for the UKs private renter population, campaigning for affordable, decent and secure homes.

Organisation: Geneva University Hospitals, (HoÌ‚pitaux Universitaires de Genève)
Purpose: To carry out a collaborative, community-based study to meet the needs of women experiencing ongoing psychological intimate partner violence. This study will help increase understanding around women's experiences of psychological intimate partner violence and how these experiences play out in daily relationship dynamics.

To conduct studies of the American English Version of the web-based, individual literacy programme called Units of Sound-Literacy that Fits. This study will include children and adults who are struggling readers and/or English language learners. It aims to provide insight on the ease of implementation and efficacy of the programme.

To identify differentiating characteristics of people with dyslexia who show treatment resistance to existing evidence-based interventions. This study seeks to identify those neurocognitive and instructional factors that contribute to dyslexia treatment resistance. Funding supports the addition of a second literacy intervention to complement an existing National Institutes of Health-funded intervention study, expanding the impact of the research and contributing to the goal of more personalised dyslexia intervention strategies tailored to individual learners.

To offer foundational learning opportunities for individuals with Down syndrome, their families and the community, by supporting speech-language, social and motor skills through therapy and education. Gigis Playhouse is a national network of sites which work to change the way the world views Down syndrome through national campaigns, educational programmes, and by empowering individuals with Down syndrome, their families and the community. This grant will support the Gigis Playhouse located in Raleigh, North Carolina.

To provide core support to GBH to help develop, amplify and celebrate the voices of young women and girls through theatre, story-telling and education. This grant will also enable GBH to strengthen its organisational policies, procedures and sustainability. GBH works to engage at-risk youth in dialogue about social justice issues affecting their communities - from gun violence to sex trafficking.

To provide core support to Glasgow Homeless Network (GHN), which works with and for people affected by homelessness in Glasgow, Scotland. GHN informs and influences policy and planning and seeks to improve practices within the housing sector in Glasgow and beyond.

Organisation: Global Alliance Against Traffic in Women (GAATW)
Purpose: To provide GAATW with core support, enabling it to make progress on its key strategic objectives. These include: increasing accountability of all anti-trafficking stakeholders; improving access to justice and combating all forms of discrimination against victims of trafficking; empowering women in the context of labour migration; and addressing emerging and cutting edge issues through research and publications. GAATW will also strive to become stronger organisationally to better support its worldwide network of over 100 organisational members.

To provide core support to GAIA for its international work to prevent plastic pollution by encouraging corporate responsibility and promoting zero waste cities. This will be done by establishing best practice for waste and plastics pollution reduction and developing a cadre of urban champions for zero waste advocacy.

To boost the participation and impact in public discourse and policy-making processes of new organisations in India working towards equitable, low-carbon, climate-resilient development. This will be done by focusing on opportunities to influence public discourse that highlight the benefits of action towards clean air and improved public health.

To design and launch targeted public campaign actions. This grant will help connect, empower and engage â€˜new entrants to the climate movement in strategic climate action globally, through a network offering content and tools tailored to their needs. The GCCA is a network of not-for-profit organisations working to mobilise civil society in support of urgent climate action.

To ensure that asylum seekers, undocumented migrants and refugees are treated with dignity and respect when in official custody. The Global Detention Project works to improve transparency in the treatment of detainees, encourage adherence to fundamental norms, reinforce advocacy aimed at reforming detention practices and promote scholarship and comparative analysis of immigration control regimes.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To provide core support to Ariadne, a network for European Funders for Human Rights and Social Justice. Ariadne, founded in 2009, seeks to: strengthen networking and collaboration among funders; facilitate the sharing of information about grant-making with the intention of enabling funders to leverage their funding more effectively; and encourage more funding for human rights and social justice in Europe.

To provide support to several UK-based organisations working around human rights and preventing attacks on human rights legislation in the United Kingdom. In addition this grant will increase funding for South-based LGBTI organisations. Global Dialogue is a London-based charity that promotes human rights and social change through innovative and collaborative philanthropy.

To assist and accelerate Chinas economic transition towards a low-carbon development path and to guide the â€˜One Belt, One Road (OBOR) Initiative in a green and sustainable direction. This will help China and the OBOR countries to achieve their climate change commitments. The project also seeks to facilitate the phasing-out of ivory trade in China.

To support the Republic of Korea, Thailand, the Philippines and Taiwan to publish Vessel Monitoring System data on the internet. The result will be an additional 10,000 industrial fishing vessels that are publicly trackable. Global Fishing Watch is promoting ocean sustainability through greater transparency. It uses cutting-edge technology to visualise, track and share data about global fishing activity in near real-time and for free.

To provide core support to the GIJN to expand its services. GIJN's mission is to spread 'watchdog journalism' across the globe, including in repressive regimes and marginalised communities. It does this by creating opportunities for journalists to share with, learn from and support one another, both online and face-to-face, and it supports journalists with world-class training and technology.

To provide core support to Global Justice Center to use innovative legal arguments and advocacy strategies, based on international law, to dismantle discriminatory legal and political structures that prevent equality and human rights for all. In particular, it will focus on: ending impunity for genocide; ensuring the right to abortions for women and girls raped in conflicts; and improving laws to protect women and girls in Burma.

To support Goldsmiths, University of London, to establish a new Centre for Contemporary Art(CCA) on its campus along with accompanying programmes. The presence of a gallery will bring significant practising artists into close contact with young talent, giving students a unique insight into how the art world operates on a practical level, as well as inspiring the m artistically.

To increase the scale of affordable personal lending and restrict the practices of exploitative lenders in the UK. The Good Faith Partnership is a consultancy to help leaders in the worlds of charity, politics, faith and business work better together on common goals.

To provide support to Good Shepherd International Foundation and its partners in more than 30 countries to improve the lives of vulnerable children, girls and women in particular. This is achieved through a focus on poverty eradication, prevention of human trafficking, protection of the rights of migrants, elimination of all forms of violence and discrimination. Good Shepherd International Foundation does this through: capacity building; resource mobilisation; promotion of good practices in service provision; and organisational learning and strengthening.

To provide support to GSS to ensure it can continue to provide its services to children, youth and families who struggle the most in New York City - particularly in East New York and Red Hook (Brooklyn) and the Bronx. GSS programmes help to ensure that more families stay united, more young people graduate from high school and college, and more young people find their voice and accomplish their goals. GSS runs two networks of community-based educational support, justice diversion and family counselling programmes in East New York and the Bronx including family foster care, residential programmes for youth in the child welfare and juvenile justice systems, and supportive housing for homeless young adults.

To help Good Shepherd Services support children, youth and families in New York City who face the greatest challenges and build on their strengths to help them gain skills for success. Good Shepherd Services also works closely with community leaders to advocate locally and nationally to make New York City a better place to live and work.

To provide support to the GSS to assist the villagers of Nong Khai Thailand. This will be done by: providing training and employment; promoting literacy and the pursuit of higher education among children and youth; educating on improved farming methods; increasing outreach services to villagers; providing nursing/hospice care to patients; and cooperating with local government departments and others to use and share resources, knowledge and experience.

To establish more than two-million hectares of protected area and buffer zone in central Mozambique as part of restoring a large contiguous landscape damaged from two decades of civil war and ensures a better life for local people. Mozambiques Gorongosa National Park is one of the wildest and least-developed areas of its kind in sub-equatorial Africa. The Gorongosa Restoration Projects aim is to reduce threats to the parks biodiversity by: increasing local support for its conservation; applying scientific knowledge to support planning and management; and increasing the resilience of household economies in the local area.

To establish more than two million hectares of protected areas in central Mozambique as part of restoring a large are a damaged from two decades of civil war. Mozambiques Gorongosa National Park is one of the wildest and least-developed areas of its kind in sub-equatorial Africa. The Gorongosa Restoration Project aims to reduce threats to the parks biodiversity by: increasing local support for its conservation; applying scientific knowledge to support planning and management; and increasing the resilience of household economies in the local area.

To provide core support to GLC to support its strategic plan and mission. GLC is a community law centre with charitable status providing free legal assistance concerning housing, homelessness, debt, discrimination, education, employment and welfare for people on low incomes in Glasgow.

To extend GLCs project Rights Hubs to NHS mental health services to: prevent vulnerable individuals becoming homeless; create a legacy of established referral routes within mental health services; and to link housing casework with advocating for policy change. GLC is a community law centre with charitable status providing free legal services concerning housing, homelessness, debt, discrimination, education, employment and welfare for people on low incomes in Glasgow.

To establish a merit-based internship programme within the Environment Programme. Interns will be Master students in International Relations at the Graduate Institute in Geneva with an interest in the environmental sector.

To establish an internship programme within Oak's Child Abuse Programme for second year masters students of the Graduate Institute Geneva who have an interest in the child rights and child protection sectors.

To support the Global Commission on Drug Policy so that it can continue its mission to change the prohibitionist paradigm that prevails in global, regional and national drug policy. This work will culminate in the UN conference on the review of the 2009 international plan of action and political declaration on drugs due in 2019.

Organisation: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity (GOSH)
Purpose: To support the Great Ormond Street Hospital (GOSH) to develop rejection-free organ transplants for children with life-threatening intestinal failure. GOSH aims to deliver functional bowel reconstruction to patients by creating an intestinal graft that will function like a normal intestine. The Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity raises funds and awareness to enable GOSH to provide world-class care for young patients and their families and to pioneer new treatments and cures for childhood illness.

To provide core funding to support GBLS to provide free civil legal aid to help individuals and families in Boston, the United States. To this end GBLS will work to help individuals and families: retain affordable housing; secure admission to emergency shelter; gain protection from domestic violence; access subsistence income for food and medical care; and recover earned wages.

To stop the flow of plastic into the oceans by calling on global fast-moving consumer goods producers around the world to phase out single-use plastics. Greenpeace offices will campaign on these issues at local, regional and global levels.
To drive urban systems change by shifting power, policies and finance towards clean, equitable and accessible public transport, walking and cycling.

To support the Greenpeace oceans campaign to investigate the world's fishing fleets in regard to human and labour rights, shark fining, corruption, overfishing and by-catch. Greenpeace is an independent global campaigning organisation that acts to protect and conserve the environment.

To be a comprehensive caregiver support centre for family and professional caregiving in North Carolina, the United States. Guiding Lights is a community-based organisation that represents the one-stop place where caregivers can turn for help and the information, resources and training.

To provide core support to the Harlem Children's Zone in New York City, whose programmes offer education, social and wellness services to more than 12,000 children and their families each year. HCZ strives to break the cycle of poverty in Central Harlem by working to build communities, strengthen families and ensure that children succeed in life.

To provide core support to Little Havens Children's Hospice so that it can provide respite care and specialist palliative care services to children under 19 years old. Little Havens Children's Hospice is the only children's hospice in Essex, the United Kingdom.

To narrow the achievement and opportunity gaps between education and careers among students from disadvantaged backgrounds in Hawaii. This grant aims to improve the resilience of Hawaiis communities by: addressing the threat of climate change; moving more low-income families and individuals into stable housing faster; and strengthening networks among community leaders working to find solutions for critical issues.

To better connect the US workforce with homelessness sectors. This will be done by promoting policy and joint work to improve employment prospects for homeless people. HA engages in national advocacy and provides services to over one million people living in the Midwest of the United States, such as housing, healthcare, economic security and legal protection.

To promote the human rights of immigrants, refugees and asylum seekers, particularly those deprived of their liberty in immigration detention. Heartland Alliance's National Immigrant Justice Center uses a multi-faceted approach of alliance-building, policy advocacy, impact litigation and strategic communications to reduce harsh enforcement practices and the number of immigrants in detention, improve detention conditions and ensure due process protections.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To provide small grants and technical assistance to grassroots LGBTI groups in West Africa. The Global Initiative for Human Rights is a re-granter that supports documentation and advocacy, provides capacity building and leadership development in order to build stronger LGBTI movements, and create favourable conditions for decriminalisation of same-sex relationships.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To promote the active involvement of men in the lives of their children in South Africa and Uganda. This work will relate in particular to early childhood development, violence reduction and prevention of child abuse. Heartlines will carry out research to develop key messages for TV and radio programmes and other resources that will be used by government bodies, not-for-profit organisations, faith-based groups and community-based organisations.

To deliver and promote a compassionate, holistic and effective response to survivors of human rights abuses. Based in London, Helen Bamber Foundation is a human rights charity working with asylum seekers, survivors of torture, human trafficking, and other forms of extreme human cruelty.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To support HelpForce Community Trust to use the power of volunteering to improve health and social care services in the UK. HelpForce believes that volunteers can help healthcare professionals and community organisations to meet the diverse care and support needs of patients, ultimately improving the health and wellbeing of people across the UK.

To enhance the quality of the evaluation and research elements of projects funded by Oak's Housing and Homelessness Programme. This grant will also provide internships that offer valuable experience in the foundation sector and that add research capacity to Oak's Housing and Homelessness team.

To provide core support to the US-based Hill Center, which provides personalised, research-based reading, writing and math instruction for students with learning differences. Hill has evolved from a small, half-day school for students with learning differences into a leader in the field. It offers a range of programmes for students, teachers, school and district partners and not-for-profits. Hill will build upon this experience to develop a scalable, technology-enabled model that provides personalised instruction to students with learning differences in public schools.

To administer and expand the Issues Affecting Women Programme's Mexico portfolio of grants working on migration, exploitation, trafficking and violence against women. In addition to enhancing due diligence and reporting on these grants, HIP will provide capacity building and networking support to these organisations. As part of its field-building efforts, HIP will also engage across sectors and with other donors to promote a more enabling environment to advance women's rights in Mexico.

To administer and expand the Issues Affecting Women Programme's Mexico portfolio of grants working on migration, exploitation, trafficking and violence against women. In addition to enhancing due diligence and reporting on these grants, HIP will provide capacity building and networking support to these organisations. As part of its field-building efforts, HIP will also engage across sectors and with other donors to promote a more enabling environment to advance women's welfare in Mexico.

To create a safe and protective environment for children in Ethiopia at risk of sexual abuse by actively engaging men and boys. This will be done in part by increasing public recognition of the positive role that men and boys play in protecting children from abuse, with a specific focus on sexual abuse and exploitation.
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: The Home for All Alliance wish to develop and test a new Danish model inspired by the British Night stop, where volunteer families open their homes for homeless youth. The new Danish model will be developed and tested in a partnership with Red Cross and Danish Red Cross Youth, who will be recruiting and supporting both families and youth. The Danish version is called "Hjem til Dig". The vision is to help young people at risk of long-term homelessness to make a good transition from youth to adulthood.

To expand HAPs SOAR Project to secure rapid Supplemental Security Income benefits (SSI/SSDI) for vulnerable individuals in Philadelphia. HAP provides free, high quality civil legal services to individuals and families who are homeless or at risk of homelessness in Philadelphia.

To end family homelessness in Massachusetts by amplifying the voices of homeless families to highlight systemic barriers and gaps in services. This grant also aims to increase the use of data and drive policy and practice recommendations. Based in Massachusetts, Homes for Families works with both homeless families and shelter providers to improve local responses to homelessness and policies.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To strengthen child protection systems, policies and capacity in Jharkhand to prevent the unnecessary separation of children from their families. When separation does occur, Hope and Homes for Children will support the development of family-based care, where children can be safely placed. Evidence will be consolidated to strengthen family-based alternative care.

To put an end to institutional care for children in Bulgaria and Moldova. This will be done through dedicated training and mentoring support for local, national and regional professionals. In addition, through opportunities to network and exchange, the project will catalyse exchanges of good practice and significantly accelerate regional reform.

The purpose of Horsens Crisis Center for Men is to prevent and remedy social problems that arise after divorce, threats of violence, physical /psychological violence through, inter alia, interviews / counselling /activities. The purpose is also to establish / restore networks for these men, to avoid social isolation and loneliness.

To provide core support to the HAP, a not-for-profit organisation that works to ensure that all those living in Pennsylvania, especially those living on low incomes, have access to safe, decent and affordable homes.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To prevent and end homelessness for families in Durham County, North Carolina and mitigate the physical, social-emotional and intellectual trauma that homeless children commonly experience. This grant aims to break the cycle of poverty existing in the community. The Durham Collaborative to End Family Homelessness brings together four organisations to work more effectively address the housing needs of families in crisis.

To establish a London hosting scheme, coordinated by HJ, which will provide short-term accommodation for migrants and support to help resolve their immigration issues. HJ is a UK-wide membership organisation of church-based night shelters, drop-in centres, day centres, housing associations and individuals. It seeks to prevent homelessness and improve living conditions.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To provide core support to HRS, the leading organisation advocating for the rights of homeless people and those in housing need in Northern Ireland.

To end persecution of the LGBT community in countries where consensual same-sex sexual relations are criminalised. The Human Dignity Trust is a London-based charity that provides free technical legal assistance to local activists and lawyers for test-case litigation. It also provides technical assistance for local media and communications strategies around litigation.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Organisation: Human Rights Law Resource Centre Ltd
Purpose: To hold Australian companies accountable for the human rights impacts of their overseas operations; strengthen domestic corporate accountability frameworks in Australia; and advocate for an Australian Charter of Human Rights. The Human Rights Law Centre is a leading Australian organisation that seeks to protect and promote human rights in Australia and in Australian activities overseas.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Purpose: To support HRWs efforts to counter the anti-rights populist surge and help strengthen the global human rights movement. As part of its core mission, HRW will conduct rigorous research (investigate), proactive media and public outreach (expose) and robust reform advocacy (change). To reinforce this work, HRW will proactively expand engagement with new partners and audiences, enlisting the publics support through value-driven campaigns.

To reduce arbitrary detention and ill treatment in the context of immigration/asylum procedures and the criminal justice system in Hungary. The grant will also support the HHC's efforts to push against regressive reforms that limit civic activism in Hungary. Based in Budapest, the HHC is one of the leading human rights watchdogs in Hungary and Central Europe.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To partner with human rights organisations and international human rights institutions in Eastern Europe and Eurasia, the Middle East, North Africa, Asia, sub-Saharan Africa and North America. This support aims to improve its information management practices through training on documentation practices and providing software solutions tailored to its data entry and analysis needs.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To support Imkaan, a network of 34organisations working to end violence against black and minority women in the UK. This grant will support efforts to ensure the sustainability of vital, life-saving specialist support services and contribute to systemic change in the UK.

To provide core support to IJC so that it can lift immigrants out of poverty by providing pro bono legal services. IJC achieves its mission through a fellowship programme that recruits skilled legal advocates, brings them to New York, then trains and supports them through two or more years of full-time service. Hosted by immigration legal services providers and community-based organisations, IJC Fellows are continually expanding the quality of the immigration services they provide.

To finalise the Impact Mapper platform and assist the development of a monitoring, evaluation, learning and communications system for Oaks Issues Affecting Women Programme. This grant also aims to train staff, grantees and evaluators to collect data which will analyse and communicate the results and impact they are helping create.

To support the HELIX Centre at Imperial College London to develop cost-effective, high-impact, design-led initiatives and technologies that improve end-of-life care. The HELIX Centre is a multidisciplinary team of industrial designers, behavioural economists, digital software developers and technologists working together at St Marys Hospital in London to develop pioneering healthcare innovations in partnership with patients and staff.

To support Impunity Watch's efforts to strengthen its functioning, in particular in the areas of communications, monitoring and evaluation and fundraising. Impunity Watch was established in 2008 to promote accountability for gross violations of human rights through the provision of research-based policy advice and advocacy.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Purpose: To support the IAWS to strengthen the network of feminist scholars and activists in universities and civil society organisations in Jharkhand via the Centre for Women’s Studies in the University of Ranchi, which is itself an IAWS initiative. The aim is to produce high-quality literature, discourse and social actions that positively influence gender-just development in the state.

Organisation: Iniciativa Mesoamericana de Mujeres Defensoras de Derechos Humanos
Purpose: To provide core support to IM-Defensoras, a local-to-regional alliance of six organisations and five national networks of women human rights defenders (WHRDs) based in Mesoamerica. Together, this alliance seeks to build and support networks and coordination efforts among WHRDs from diverse social movements and causes in the region. Since its establishment in 2010, IM-Defensorashas supported activists in El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico and Nicaragua.

To explore, through practical research, how18-25 year olds given prison sentences can thrive in the community after release. Innovation Unit's mission is to grow new solutions to complex social challenges.

To ensure that the people directly affected by the 2017 Grenfell Tower disaster in London are supported, their voices are heard, their efforts to see truth uncovered are supported and their recommendations are taken forward. The aim of this grant is also to build a coalition for the adoption of the 'Hillsborough Law', which includes a duty of candor and parity of funding for families in relation to inquests and public inquiries. INQUEST is the only UK charity focusing on the investigation of contentious state related deaths, and where wider issues of state and corporate accountability are in question.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Organisation: Institute for Human Rights and Business
Purpose: To implement human rights throughout the world of sport in order to protect the rights of children. The IHRB successfully managed the Mega Sporting Events platform, bringing together mega-sporting event organisers with 37 State and non-state actors to push for change.

To provide core support to train human rights activists and non-governmental organisations to investigate and document international crimes. The IICI will raise the capacity of investigators through its residential international investigators courses and other courses developed and delivered in countries where there is a need for these skills. Based in The Hague, the IICI is an international not-for-profit organisation dedicated to providing training in the investigation of genocide, war crimes and crimes against humanity.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Organisation: Institute for Transportation and Development Policy (ITDP)
Purpose: To improve and accelerate the adoption of low carbon, inclusive mobility and urban development in Brazilian cities, in particular in the Recife Metropolitan Region. It is hoped this will result in increased access to opportunities for all, especially women, children and individuals with low incomes.

Organisation: Institute for Transportation and Development Policy (ITDP)
Purpose: To support the creation of high quality transport systems that make cities more liveable, equitable and sustainable. In collaboration with the Government and the private sector, ITDP aims to implement sustainable transportation projects in India.

To improve practice and strategic learning in UK foundations by funding an Evaluation Roundtable to provide foundation leaders with an opportunity to refine and deepen their thinking and practice. The IVAR uses research to develop practical responses to challenges and creates opportunities for people to learn from the findings.

To support a solid, reliable and recognised body of experts and activists in Brazil committed to the environmental and economic issues relating to energy production. The coalition aims to support the planning and operation of the energy sector towards a zero-carbon path. This will bring to the decision-makers all its co-benefits in terms of quality of life, social development, health and the preservation of Brazilian ecosystems.

To strengthen Brazilian civil society in the face of climate change by supporting the Brazilian Government to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Instituto Clima eSociedade supports projects in Brazil that target climate change and which work to build a just and prosperous society.

To support stronger Brazilian civil society action around climate change and other areas of social change. By doing so it is hoped that Brazils greenhouse gas emissions will be reduced and low-carbon sustainable development implemented. Instituto Clima e Sociedade supports projects that target climate change and which work to build a just and prosperous society in Brazil.

To contribute to the population control of the Aedes mosquito, reducing occurrences of Zika, Dengue, Chikungunya and other associated diseases. This will be done through the consolidation of the Aedes Trapp System as a tool for community monitoring, increasing awareness and engagement of the most vulnerable communities, especially women, on data collection and prevention/mitigation actions.

To provide core support to Instituto PAPAI, an organisation that promotes social justice and contributes to the guarantee of human rights in Brazil, in order to eliminate inequalities. Its focus will be on working, in particular, with men and on masculinities.

To support a database that builds knowledge to better assist policy improvements and peoples safety in Brazilian metropolitan areas. This will prevent life-threatening situations and strengthen partnerships between civil society and public institutions.

Organisation: International Center for Living Aquatic Resources Management (ICLARM) also known as Worldfish
Purpose: To create enabling environments for policies and investments that support people dependent on small-scale fisheries in developing countries. This grant aims to improve management practices and food and nutrition security, which will result in equitable governance and poverty alleviation. This will be achieved by building the capacity and commitment for coordination and collective action of agencies, initiatives and funders working together to strengthen the governance of small-scale fisheries.

Organisation: International Center for Research on Women
Purpose: To advance knowledge and the evidence base on what works to end violence against children in East Africa. The ICRW will support Oak partners implementing violence prevention programmes in Uganda and Tanzania to monitor programme implementation, and document and disseminate the outcomes and learning to inform practice and policy making.

To support the ICTJ to increase its institutional philanthropic capacity and diversify its funding base. With headquarters in New York, several country offices, numerous programs operating around the globe and managed from our headquarters, and an office in The Hague, ICTJ works across society and borders to challenge the causes and address the consequences of massive human rights violations. It does this by affirming victims dignity, fighting impunity and promoting responsive institutions.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Organisation: International Centre for Women's Rights Protection and Promotion "La Strada"
Purpose: To provide core support to La Strada based in the Republic of Moldova, to enable it to continue working with women and children affected by domestic violence and human trafficking, and with children survivors of sexual exploitation and abuse. The grant will create opportunities for La Strada to deepen its work with women and children by tackling sexual violence against women and girls as well as child safety online in response to the emerging needs.

Organisation: International Committee on the Rights of Sex Workers in Europe
Purpose: To empower sex workers in Europe to become an active part of the response to trafficking and exploitation in the sex industry. Sex workers have been historically excluded from the European anti-trafficking movement. This grant aims to build their capacities and advocate for their inclusion in policy debates. The ICRSE is a network of sex worker organisations and their allies working for policies and practice that respect and uphold the human and labour rights of sex workers throughout Europe and Central Asia.

To ensure that the human rights of refugees, asylum seekers and migrants impacted by immigration detention are respected, protected and fulfilled. IDC seeks to bring about changes in legislation, policy and practice that: prevent, mitigate and respond to the harms associated with immigration detention; and promote alternatives to detention. It works through: network and capacity building; advocacy; awareness-raising and campaigns; and research and reporting.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To support policy research think tanks in Asia in relation to climate mitigation-related policies. The initial focus will be on developing countries with high emissions, in particular Asia. The International Development Research Centre funds research in developing countries to promote growth, reduce poverty, and drive large-scale positive change.

To provide core support to IFIP. Its mission is to convene Indigenous Peoples, donors and foundations to advance partnerships that can improve the lives of Indigenous Peoples globally, build communities of practice among donors and address the challenges of our times.

Organisation: International Institute of Social Studies of Erasmus University Rotterdam
Purpose: To undertake a participatory research project among adolescents in Tanzania and Bulgaria exploring adolescents perceptions of healthy relationships. This grant will lay the ground for the design and implementation of advocacy and dissemination activities related to the research.
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: To support the operations of the New York headquarters of the International Legal Foundation in its efforts to increase awareness of the global crisis in indigent defence. This grant will support the ILF to: develop best practices and lessons learned for the delivery of accessible, effective, sustainable and credible legal aid; and encourage greater funding for legal aid activities. The ILF assists post-conflict and transitional countries in establishing public defender systems that provide effective, quality criminal defence services for the poor.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To encourage greater civic activity through data-driven offline and online activities that leverage historical information to enhance understanding and analysis of human rights and freedoms in Russia. International Memorial is an historical and civil rights society that operates in post-Soviet states.

Organisation: International Network of Civil Liberties Organisations (INCLO)
Purpose: To protect fundamental guarantees with respect to social protest, privacy rights, religious freedom and civic activism. The grant will also assist in strengthening members tech, litigation and fundraising capacity through a series of consultancies and peer to peer exchanges.

To ensure smaller-scale tuna fisheries are strategically engaged in decision-making for the international management of tuna resources. This will be done by ensuring that smaller-scale tuna fisheries participate in the Regional Fisheries Management Organizations. The International Pole and Line Foundation works to bridge the gap between demand and supply of tuna.

Organisation: International Rehabilitation Council of Torture Victims
Purpose: To provide financial assistance to rehabilitation centres in low- and middle-income countries and in acute financial need. The IRCT is a global network of 157 rehabilitation centres with a secretariat in Copenhagen.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To support International Rhino Foundation to reduce rhino poaching and protect black and white rhinos in the Lowveld conservancies of Zimbabwe and one-horned rhinos in Assam, India. Both programmes are strongly supported by local communities and local and national governments.

To initiate or support and document a just transition to low and zero emissions transport and mobility in at least five major cities worldwide. These cities include Sydney, Oslo, Stockholm and Toronto. The initiative will also encourage and expand fossil-free public transport and electric vehicles with a focus on building support for these through job creation and decent work. The Just Transition Centre is a new initiative from the International Trade Union Confederation and its partners.

To build capacity for effective law enforcement and prosecution of wildlife crimes by leveraging US legislative tools against transnational criminal organisations, exploiting investigative information on criminal networks and working alongside US officials. The International Wildlife Trust is a start-up organisation that works to ensure the prosecution of transnational criminals involved in the illegal wildlife trade.
To increase the quality and quantity of reporting around conservation efforts - particularly in the UK and Europe.

To support and enable the Inuit to guide and direct the future management of critical marine habitats in the North water polynya, an ice-free region between Greenland and Nunavut. This region has been important to the Inuit for generations and represents a globally significant area of marine productivity. The project will also support Inuit participation in a variety of policy forms and decision-making processes related to Arctic marine areas at local, regional and international scales.

To align the world’s capital markets with the sustainable management of fisheries and aqua culture. Investor Watch works to align capital markets with the goal of social and ecological sustainability.

To improve reproductive and sexual health outcomes for young women and adolescent girls in districts of Jharkhand and West Bengal. This will be done by increasing their access to sexual and reproductive health services.

To provide professional development for coaches and teachers in order to increase the academic achievement of all students and decrease the achievement gap across the school district in North Carolina.

Organisation: Ishe Anesu Multi-purpose Centre for Disabled Children
