Purpose: To support disabled children in Zimbabwe. Ishe Anesu Project is located within the Hilltop United Methodist Church premises in Sakubva, Mutare. Ishe Anesu is an after-school project designed to provide education to vulnerable children.
To support ISHTAR in following: 1. Continue its development of their kitchen and food production 2. Rebuilding of their shop into a gourmet shop 3. Development of products to the gourmet shop

To strengthen and scale up palliative care for vulnerable populations to improve their quality of life in Chitungwiza, Mutare and Marondera, Zimbabwe. The project will strengthen and expand palliative care services through training of healthcare professionals and community caregivers.

To provide core support to Iswar Sankalpa to enable it to continue to work with homeless men and women with mental illnesses in Kolkata, India. Iswar Sankalpa is a not-for-profit organisation that runs homeless shelters offering refuge and recovery services to some of the most vulnerable and marginalised people in the country.

To improve the education, health and nutritional status of 5,800 early childhood development students in Sanyati District. This grant will also support the renovation and refurbishment of classrooms at five primary schools in Zvimba District for the safety and optimal learning of an additional 200 children.

To enable women and girls from diverse communities and backgrounds to access public services and move freely and safely in Ranchi and Hazaribagh, Jharkhand. This will be done by taking a comprehensive, multi-sectoral approach to supporting local governments, civil society organisations and communities to prevent and respond to sexual harassment and sexual violence in public spaces.

To support a network of organisations working to enable poor urban and rural communities to become food secure in West Bengal. By building the capacity of its member organisations it hopes to empower communities and support the state government to implement the National Food Security and National Rural Employment Guarantee Acts. JSK seeks to support and promote social organisations doing welfare and developmental work in rural West Bengal.

To support the European Environment and Health Initiative to strengthen civil society engagement to improve EU policies on endocrine disrupting chemicals (EDCs). Despite widespread use of EDCs and evidence of them being health hazards, the EU has not yet properly regulated these substances. This grant aims to encourage EU decision-makers to adopt an inclusive and protective approach for regulating EDCs.

To enable the Jericho Foundation, based in Birmingham in the United Kingdom, to become sustainable and increase training and employment opportunities for its clients. The Jericho Foundation supports people to become fulfilled, skilled and employed.

To support Jobs for the Future’s Student-Centered Learning Research Collaborative and its efforts to evaluate the impact of student-centred learning methods on students with learning differences. This grant also aims to support Jobs for the Future to: test equitable measures of school performance; and design a youth research fellowship model to assess impact of learner-centred approaches on students who learn differently.

To support organisations in Jharkhand working on environmental issues and with capacity for research, planning and implementation. The main focus will be on clean energy and energy access. The Initiative for Sustainable Energy Policy at the John Hopkins University works to identify opportunities for policy reforms that allow emerging economies to advance at minimal economic and environmental costs.

To carry out a study to better understand the factors in early adolescence that either predispose young people to sexual health risks or promote healthy sexuality. This will build the research base in the Global South.
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: To work with young adults in North Carolina who have serious mental health conditions to improve their outcomes in employment and independent living, while reducing the risk of homelessness, incarceration and suicide. Joshs Hope Foundation provides therapeutic support, vocational training, job preparedness and life skills. It helps young people to identify potential employers and housing opportunities and assists them in the transition to successful independent living.

To provide core support to JASS, a multi-regional and locally led women’s human rights network, enabling it to continue to strengthen and amplify the voice, visibility and collective power of women in Southeast Asia, Southern Africa, and Mesoamerica. Specifically, JASS accompanies and strengthens the leadership capacity and movement strategy of grassroots women in mixed organisations and movements to centre women’s and feminist agendas and perspectives in broad movements for equality, democracy, and social, political and environmental justice.

Organisation: Justice in Aging (formerly National Senior Citizens Law Center)
Purpose: To prevent cuts to funding and eligibility for Supplemental Security Income (SSI) in the US, which many seniors and people with disabilities rely on to survive. This grant will also promote policies that expand access to SSI. Justice in Aging has been operating since 1972 using the power of law to fight for the rights of low-income seniors.

Organisation: Justice in Aging (formerly National Senior Citizens Law Center)
Purpose: To improve the appeal process of the Supplemental Security Income (SSI) in the US, which is a key safety net welfare benefit claimed by 8,300,000 people claiming SSI. To this end, JiA will promote new legislation that increases SSI levels and widens eligibility. JiA is a US organisation that uses the power of the law to fight poverty by securing access to affordable healthcare, economic security and the courts for older adults with limited resources.

To provide core support to Kalayaan to work with migrant domestic workers (MDW), especially victims of labour exploitation or trafficking, through direct support services and campaigning aimed at improving the legal and policy framework affecting all MDW. Kalayaan is the only advice organisation in the UK that works specifically with MDWs to understand their rights, access justice in case of exploitation or abuse and advocate to improve their quality of life.

To support the social welfare system in West Bengal to provide access to health, education, welfare, protection, poverty alleviation and livelihood services to survivors of trafficking. Tafteesh is a justice programme for survivors of human trafficking for sexual exploitation, forced labour and other purposes. It aims to integrate the voices of survivors into anti-trafficking interventions.

To implement a composting system for organic waste in a region of 200,000 people in India. This will increase recycling rates and pushback on large scale centralised systems. The zero-waste model will seek to ensure composting at source from 9,000 slum and 60,000 non-slum households as well as100 non-residential institutions by the end of project period.

To increase the number of Alaskan natives who are skilled in the areas of arctic marine science, research and advocacy. The programme will run for ten years and will create a prestigious scholarship for junior and senior undergraduate students, influence youth to pursue preferred degrees in marine science and provide internship opportunities.

To provide core support to Keeping Children Safe to advocate for the adoption of international standards on child protection measures and to help Oak Foundation deliver on its own Safeguarding Children Policy. Keeping Children Safe aims to strengthen the capacity of organisations to protect children globally from all forms of violence, abuse and exploitation.

To continue to support KIND's project, 'Protecting Central American children - on the move and at home', which aims to protect, empower and advance the rights of unaccompanied Central American migrant and refugee children. The project addresses the specific needs of migrant children returning to South American countries and connects them to educational and economic opportunities.
To increase the survival rate and improve the quality of life of the children with cancer and related blood disorders in a loving and caring environment.

Through a multi-disciplinary advisory team to ensure optimal interior decoration in the examination rooms for perpetrators and victims of assaults and rape, who undergo forensic medical examination at Department of Forensic Science, University of Copenhagen.

Sanasa - Let's Build Something Together! Something that creates pride. "The goal: In the short term, the goal is for the young people to get a basic introduction and insight into the professional environment and train in job relationships so that they get well prepared to begin and complete the foundation course at avocational school. The idea behind the project is to awaken the motivation and desire for education by increased by participation in relevant and meaningful work, which will help to create street art in the local area.

The project mainly deals with three areas: Knowledge / Content, Competence and Technology. In practice, it means, among other things, the development and implementation of a number of new educational initiatives and accompanying teaching materials, massive competence development of teachers and managers, the building of modern and sustainable IT infrastructure at schools, and delivery of iPads to all primary school students in Greenland. The impetus behind the project is a common desire to cooperate and, once and for all, to make primary school a locomotive that will ensure that future generations in Greenland become much better educated, globalisation and self-employed than it is now.

To support funds to establish a garage to the only slope in Tasiilaq. The garage will also be used as storage for skiing equipments which the department is lending to children for free. At the same time, part of the garage is planned to be used as a place of residence and as a workshop. Access to the lift is free for children and youngsters up to and including 16-years children. And the rent for skis are free for everybody.

To provide healthcare through a well-equipped and functional clinic, promote early treatment for cancer and adherence to anti-retroviral treatment for patients who are HIV positive. This project also aims to raise awareness among youth on HIV/AIDS prevention.

To ensure people from the European Economic Area receive access to specialist legal representation to prevent their forcible removal because they are rough sleeping. This Lambeth Law Centre will use strategic litigation to challenge the UK governments policy. Learning will be shared to support front line organisations. LLC provides free legal advice, representation and casework linked mainly to asylum, immigration, employment, housing, debt and welfare benefit issues.

The purpose of the application is to gain time and resources to rethink the whole organization LOKK in order to become a modern, sustainable and more business-oriented organization. LOKK received public funds to run its organization and operation of a secretariat. These funds are no longer available. LOKK is currently threatened with closure. LOKK must therefore adapt to the new reality of having to raise funds for survival. LOKK has since its inception in 1987 been a member organization but its members can only pay a small subscription fee and new many decisions can only be taken at the general assembly, which is held once a year.
The general aim of the application is to continue the development and professionalisation of LOKK - from member-organisation to a modern, sustainable and more business-oriented organisation.

To provide core support to LAWRS, so that it can continue to empower Latin American migrant women experiencing violence, exploitation and abuse in the UK. LAWRS provides services, prevention and empowerment. It also campaigns around migrant women's rights.

To create pathways to opportunity for students from immigrant families. Latinx Education Center empowers families to improve conditions for themselves, their families and communities in the US. Latinx works to dismantle barriers that prevent immigrant families from accessing higher education.

To further develop the website Resources to Recover (www.rtor.org) that guides, supports and provides best practice resources for mental healthcare. This grant has a specific focus on increasing the resources and support available to young adults and their families to promote early intervention in cases of mental illness to improve recovery and quality of life.

To continue support for the organisations outdoor learning programmes in North Carolina, the US and to help ensure its financial sustainability. Based on research that shows outdoor learning experiences enhance children's imaginations, strengthen attention spans, boost classroom performance and provide many health benefits, Learning Outside provides year-round activities to connect children with the natural world and opportunities for youth who do not have ready access to explore the outdoors.

Organisation: Legal and Social Support Charity Foundation "Sphere"
Purpose: To provide core support to the Russian LGBT Network â€œSphereâ€
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To provide expert legal advice to Russian not-for-profit organisations to ensure compliance with current laws regulating their activities. This grant will also enhance the legal literacy of the leadership and staff of not-for-profit organisations in Russia.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Organisation: Legal Initiative for Forest and Environment (LIFE)
Purpose: To provide core support in order to improve, strengthen and build LIFE as a leading environmental legal justice, research and evidence-based advocacy organisation in India and South Asia. LIFE works to ensure that people can: freely access information around environmental impacts; participate meaningfully in decision-making; and demand enforcement of environmental laws or compensation for damage.

To reduce the barriers faced by homeless people in Scotland, through the provision by: providing of legal advice through a drop-in service (including for refugees) and, capacity building; in the sector and pursuing systemic change through strategic litigation. The overall aim is to effect permanent change at local and national government level, through strategic casework and legal education. The project will be delivered by the Legal Services Agency, a Scottish law centre based in Glasgow.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To develop and train educators to create supportive schools for thousands of children who struggle to learn because of traumatic experiences. These learning environments will better support a wider variety of students with learning differences. The Lesley University Center for Special Education is collaborating with the Trauma and Learning Policy Initiative at Massachusetts Advocates for Children on this project.

To develop the â€˜Harlesden Working Together project in London, the UK and to generate activities that address social exclusion in practical and strategic ways. Lift was set up in 2001 by homeless people working together to improve the homelessness situation in the borough of Brent in London. The organisation offers a range of housing, employment and other support services and keeps inclusion and empowerment of homeless and disadvantaged people at its heart.

To help low-income individuals and families in the US to achieve economic stability and well-being and to lift families out of poverty permanently. LIFT has centres in Boston, Chicago, Los Angeles, New York, Philadelphia, and Washington D.C where advocates help members to find jobs, housing, and/or education.
To protect African elephants and rhinos by strengthening regional conservation coordination in eastern and southern Africa. Lilongwe Wildlife Trust is a wildlife charity based in Malawi.

In the project, Den Musikalske Lykkepille works with art and music as the primus engine for positive changes for vulnerable children and their mothers especially in Crisis Centres and hospitals. Den Musikalske Lykkepille is based on inclusion that gives all children, regardless of background, good experiences and strengthens their social skills and resilience.

To support Citizens UK to enhance community organising and training across different geographies. In addition, Citizens UK aims to develop its campaigns and impact in: (1) the delivery of affordable housing in London through Community Land Trusts; and (2) the Just Money and Living Wage Campaigns. Citizens UK is an alliance of local community groups in the UK that work for the common good of the local area and the wider community.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To provide core support to Pathway, a UK-wide non-governmental organisation which provides healthcare to homeless patients during and after hospital stays at University College Hospital. This grant also aims to advise other hospitals to establish similar services, coordinate a faculty concerned with equal access to health services, and advocate for change to ensure homeless and excluded groups gain access to health services.

To improve the quality of care and experience for homeless and vulnerably-housed people in London who are nearing the end of their lives. A collaboration between Pathway, Marie Curie, UCLH and St Mungos will bring together experts in the healthcare and homelessness field.

Organisation: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine
Purpose: To prevent the sexual exploitation of children by promoting innovative programming based on social norm theory. The Gender Violence and Health Centre at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine seeks to broaden the partners involved in the Learning Initiative on Norms, Exploitation and Abuse (LINEA) Network and move the agenda from basic research to the implementation and evaluation of interventions designed to address sexual exploitation in different settings.
Sub Programme: Ending the sexual exploitation of children

Purpose: To test the Eradicating Child Sexual Abuse (ECSA) toolkit in Brazil and Bulgaria. ECSA assists organisations to develop and implement strategies for the prevention of child sexual abuse. The Lucy Faithfull Foundation has published a free online toolkit designed to help agencies and communities prevent children and young people from being sexually abused. The toolkit provides resources for professionals to meet the needs of their local community. Lucy Faithfull Foundation is a UK-based child protection charity dedicated to reducing the risk of child sex abuse.
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: To implement a coordinated strategy to serve youth who have dropped out of school and who are not employed. Made in Durham will work to improve the lives of youth by connecting them to college and or paid work that leads to self-sufficiency and to improving the local economy by fulfilling employers need for local talent.

To provide core support to MADRE to enable it to continue to support community-based women’s groups worldwide facing war, disaster and injustice. MADRE will meet urgent needs in communities and build lasting solutions to the crises women face.

Organisation: Maggie Keswick Jencks Cancer Caring Centres Trust
Purpose: To support Maggies organisational and programmatic developments, so that it fulfils its ambition to increase the number of Maggies Centres in the UK, from the current 18 to 21, by 2019. Maggie is a UK-based charity offering free practical, emotional and social support for people with cancer and their families and friends. Support is provided in extraordinary buildings, which are meant to be active elements in the healing process.

To support the operations of an independent online news outlet called 444, which provides unbiased reporting on social, political and economic issues in Hungary and Central/Eastern Europe. 444 will produce news, investigative pieces, video investigations and other content.

To upgrade the skills of women construction workers in Ranchi, Jharkand, and create an enabling environment whereby women with enhanced skills are able to find better work opportunities and enjoy higher wages and improved conditions of work. Based in India, MHT works to enhance civic engagement among citizens, particularly slum residents, women and the rural poor, by promoting Community-Based Organizations (CBOs) and grassroot women's leadership.

To continue Maitris work with abandoned widows in Vrindavan, India. This project is designed to help restore dignity and respect to women who have been abandoned by ensuring their access to citizenship rights, and by providing healthcare, basic nutrition, shelter and income generation training. Maitri is a New Delhi-based organisation which implements a range of projects that support women and fight for access to healthcare for migrant workers and their families, among other work.

To enable Make Room to increase media coverage of the US rental-housing crisis; engage people on its digital platform to take action and speak directly to elected officials; and work directly with local communities to design and implement campaigns. Make Room is a US-based not-for-profit organisation that uses online media to mobilise people to action around the housing crisis.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Organisation: Makerere University College of Health Sciences.
Purpose: To work with and support parents to help prevent violence. This will be done by: optimising the implementation of evidence-based programmes; improving coordination of shared learning; and establishing ongoing partnerships with government, civil society actors and other key stakeholders. Makerere University, based in Kampala, Uganda, is one of the oldest and most prestigious Universities in Africa.

To support Red Umbrella Fund to strengthen sex worker organisations to contribute to laws, policies and practices that end the criminalisation, exploitation and trafficking of sex-workers around the world. Red Umbrella Fund is a global fund managed by and for sex-workers. It is hosted by Mama Cash, an international women's fund that supports women's rights initiatives around the globe to challenge the root causes of injustice.

To provide core support to Mama Cash, enabling it to strengthen emerging and self-led feminist groups through its grant-making and accompaniment support. Mama Cash also strengthens women's funds to: play a key role in resourcing and supporting local women's rights groups and movements. Additionally, it seeks to influence the donor community to obtain more and better funding for women's rights.

To develop a more inclusive and sustainable Men Engage network in Europe to make men and boys allies in gender justice and in the elimination of sexual and gender-based violence and child abuse. This one-year project will strengthen Men Engage Europe's structure, role and responsibilities. It will also improve coordination and interconnectivity among the networks 60 member organisations.

To support the Mara Elephant Project Trust to conduct research on elephant ecology in order to conserve the ecosystem and secure a viable and sustainable population of elephants in the Mara-Serengeti in East Africa. The Mara Elephant Project Trust has implemented GPS radio satellite tracking collars in the Mara to provide fresh insight into the movement of elephants. It aims to protect the elephants of the Mara using tracking technology.

To highlight the Brazil Programme issues through the production of multi-media content distributed through an on-line news portal and social media. In addition, Marco Zero Conteúdo will conduct fact checking and investigative journalism to inform public debate around Brazil Programme priorities.

To support Marie Curie, based in the UK, in its mission to help people and their families living with a terminal illness make the most of the time they have together. This is done through the provision of expert care, emotional support, research and guidance. This grant will help enable Marie Curie to rollout a new model of locally, clinically coordinated care in the UK to better meet the needs of its patients and families, NHS referrers and other agencies.

To prevent sexual, emotional and physical violence of boys and girls aged 13-16 years in Latvia. This will be done by: increasing adolescents' understanding and abilities to challenge harmful social norms and stereotypes that drive gender inequality and violence; equipping professionals in schools, youth centres and foster homes to prevent violence; initiating systemic changes to improve the legislation and institutional practices; and opening a national discussion on issues of violence against children.
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: Kattunneq II is a project run by The Maryfoundation. It builds on the experiences from Kattunneq - women's shelters in Greenland and will aim to further the professionalization of shelter services. Kattunneq II will focus more explicitly on embedding the professional boost of the shelters both on a local level as well as a national level. Kattunneq II will furthermore comprise the upcoming women's shelter in Tasiilaq in East Greenland focusing on the local foundation, as well as including the new centre in the current network of women's shelters in Greenland.

To support Marys Meals to deliver a school feeding programme to over 23,650 children in Matabelel and North in Zimbabwe. This will reduce classroom hunger and promote access, participation and progression through primary education. This project seeks to increase community support for education and provide families with a social safety net in times of food insecurity.

To improve the lives of people living with HIV/AIDS and to strengthen child protection systems. The project aims to contribute and complement efforts in selected areas to reduce poverty and strengthen households economically through income-generating activities.

To support Massachusetts Advocates for Children to share evidence from their Trauma-Sensitive Schools study which will help more educators and policymakers to understand the need for trauma sensitive schools in the United States. It will also help build understanding around what trauma-sensitive school cultures can look like and how they can empower and harness the talents of educators and of students.

To make economic stability a reality for more people throughout Massachusetts, so that those on lower income scan become economically independent. Mass Budget is a not-for-profit organisation producing independent analysis of state budget and tax policies to improve the lives of people on low incomes.

To provide core support to Medical Justice, based in London, which focuses on ending medical mistreatment of detainees. In addition, Medical Justice facilitates their access to appropriate healthcare and deploys research, policy analysis and litigation to campaign for an end to immigration detention.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Organisation: Medical Research Council of South Africa
Purpose: To promote active and ethical engagement of children in generating evidence to better understand the impact of sexual violence in their lives and to gather evidence of what works (in the context of families) to prevent maltreatment and violence against children. This information will be used to build the evidence for prevention of violence against children and women. The Sexual Violence Research Initiative (SVRI) is a global programme hosted by the Medical Research Council of South Africa. As knowledge managers in the field, the SVRI gathers, develops, distils and disseminates knowledge to strengthen prevention of and response for sexual violence and related types of violence in low and middle income countries.

Organisation: Medical Research Council of South Africa
Purpose: To promote active and ethical engagement of children in generating evidence to better understand the impact of sexual violence in their lives and to gather evidence of what works (in the context of families) to prevent maltreatment and violence against children. This information will be used to build the evidence for prevention of violence against children and women. The Sexual Violence Research Initiative (SVRI) is a global programme hosted by the Medical Research Council of South Africa. As knowledge managers in the field, the SVRI gathers, develops, distils and disseminates knowledge to strengthen prevention of and response for sexual violence and related types of violence in low and middle income countries.

To strengthen Memoria Abiertas role regionally and internationally by sharing its expertise with communities who have experienced gross violations of human rights. Based in Buenos Aires, Memoria Abierta preserves and disseminates documentation of abuses perpetrated by the military dictatorship in Argentina. It builds support for accountability processes and helps victims achieve social recognition of crimes.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Purpose: To support the outfitting of a hospital on Global Mercy, a new ship which will serve patients in Africa. This new ship will more than double the capacity of the organisation Mercy Ships to deliver life-saving and life-changing surgery to patients and training for medical practitioners in host nations. The ship will serve patients who would otherwise lack access to safe, free healthcare.

To support the Mermaid III project in Denmark to develop methods to diagnose ovarian cancer at the earliest possible stage. Mermaid Projektet was founded in 2002 to initiate and finance ground breaking international projects in gynaecological cancer research. The project will be conducted in Denmark, in collaboration with international players, and will take advantage of the extraordinary Danish health data available through the health registers and biobanks.

To support people in their homes using a MAVM resilience model that enhances health and wellbeing. This will be done by helping people to develop social connections and strategies to cope with unforeseen events. The approach will be evaluated from a health perspective and also any impact on housing circumstances. Merthyr and the Valleys Mind is based in south Wales with a focus on supporting people with mental health and emotional wellbeing needs.

To re-grant to seven of Oak's key conservation partners working in the Meso-American Reef region. This fund aims to provide long-term financial sustainability to natural resource management and conservation initiatives in Belize, Guatemala, Honduras, and Mexico.

To establish a Belize Marine Conservation Trust Fund in order to provide long-term financial sustainability for natural resources management and conservation initiatives. This grant will enhance the Mesoamerica Reef Funds grant-making capability so that it can operate optimally.

To provide long-term financial sustainability to natural resource management and conservation initiatives in Mexico, Belize, Guatemala and Honduras. Marfund will continue to strengthen alliances among the countries and consolidate donor contributions to common and strategic regional objectives.

To provide quality multi-faceted HIV/AIDS programmes to various target groups in the Midlands Province. This project also aims to promote child protection through the creation of safer environments for children.

To provide core support to MiracleFeet to enable it to continue its work in existing partner countries and to expand into new countries to reach and treat more children born with clubfoot. MiracleFeet has a proven programme model and track record in increasing access to proper treatment for children born with clubfoot in developing countries through partnerships with local healthcare providers. MiracleFeet envisions a world where all children born with clubfoot can live productive, active and healthy lives. It aims to eradicate untreated clubfoot globally.

To work with local implementing partner, the Zimbabwe Sustainable Clubfoot Programme (ZSCP), to establish an effective and sustainable countrywide clubfoot treatment programme in Zimbabwe. The long-term goal is to eliminate clubfoot as a lifelong disabling condition in the country.

To give core support to MCS to provide round-the-clock support and advice to anyone confronted with or fearing a child's disappearance in Switzerland. MCS will also continue to advocate for improvements in the way the Swiss authorities respond to missing children cases, and to conduct campaigns to raise awareness around risks and prevention.

To support decentralised village-level renewable energy powered mini-grids, which will allow rural communities to access modern forms of energy to raise their incomes and reduces CO2 emissions. This method has been proven to deliver social, environmental and financial benefits.

To expand counselling and treatment efforts for vulnerable single parents, pregnant women and other vulnerable families in Denmark. The counselling services aim to strengthen the abilities of parents, empowering them to provide their children with the best possible start in life in a safe and caring environment.

To support Moorfields Eye Hospital and its research partner, the University College London Institute of Ophthalmology, to develop new treatments for eye diseases. Moorfields Eye Hospital and the UCL Institute of Ophthalmology will be focussing on macular degeneration. Moorfields Eye Charity raises funds to help the hospital: provide care for its patients; educate researchers and clinicians; and support cutting-edge research to develop new treatments for diseases that cause blindness.

To build closer and more inclusive societies, resilient to the appeal of xenophobia and authoritarian populism. MIC will address the drivers of populism and intolerance through messaging that affirms pluralism and tolerance as patriotic values. It will also develop content and campaigns and create community-based movements to address populism and intolerance.

To promote a wider discussion on human rights, including LGBTI rights, by supporting independent human rights film festivals worldwide. Based in the Netherlands, Movies that Matter is a not-for-profit foundation that supports film festivals and cinematographic events that promote human rights dialogue and encourage people to stand up for human rights.
To provide core support to Movimento dos Pimpadores, an international movement based in Brazil that strives to generate income and promote the invaluable work of waste collectors.

Organisation: Munk School of Global Affairs, University of Toronto
Purpose: To produce evidence-based research on targeted digital threats against civil society groups and build their capacity to recognise and respond to these threats. Based at the Munk School of Global Affairs at the University of Toronto, Citizen Lab focuses on research, development and high-level strategic policy and legal engagement at the intersection of information and communication technologies, human rights and global security.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To expand and conserve wilderness areas and to protect the flora, fauna and endemic species residing within the Munyawana Conservancy. The grant will support several conservation projects, which include: monitoring spotted hyenas; studying biodiversity of grassland and soils; and dehorning black and white rhinos for their protection.
To support Lisbeth Sagens' classical band of musicians who visit seriously ill children and their families in hospital and give concerts.

To continue the national MenCare programme in Switzerland to change social norms by engaging men in gender equality and increasing men's participation and responsibility in children's lives. The ultimate aim of this work is to prevent child abuse. Founded in 2005, manner.ch is an umbrella association for Swiss professional and voluntary organisations working on gender equality issues related to boys, men and fathers.
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: Café Klare wish to be able to continue the work with the women

To provide core support to the National Alliance to End Homelessness to further its mission of preventing and ending homelessness in the United States. Through research and data, the Alliance works to discover and build support for solutions for homelessness. It also works with partners to develop policy and resources to support solutions and builds local capacity to implement solutions. It works collaboratively with the public, private and not-for-profit sectors.

Organisation: National Center for Child Abuse Prevention
Purpose: To provide core support to the NCCAP, which works to prevent child sexual abuse and exploitation in Moldova. NCCAPs vision is a society in which children are protected from all forms of violence. Its mission is to contribute to the reduction of violence against children though prevention activities, capacity development and specialised service provision.

To support NCLD to continue managing Understood.org, an online platform for parents of children who have learning and attention issues. This grant will also support the development of: a new online platform called Understood for Educators; and programming specific to young adults with learning differences. This will include leadership development and the creation of an advisory board of young adults.

Organisation: National Center for Special Education in Charter Schools
Purpose: To support NCSECS to develop and implement a communications strategy to provide data, analysis, guidance and insight to charter school authorisers, operators, state policy makers and others. This will ensure that charter schools in the United States are schools of choice for students, including those who learn differently.

To support Youth Voices for Safe Homes of NCBI Switzerland to prevent various forms of domestic violence against children and youth in Switzerland. This project raises awareness among young people about their rights and empowers them to address and prevent various forms of domestic violence. This includes corporal punishments, sibling or parental conflicts, gender violence and intimate violence partnerships with their peers and relatives. NCBI is a Swiss organisation focused on violence prevention, prejudice reduction and intercultural integration.

Support Youth Voices for Safe Homes of NCBI Switzerland to prevent various forms of domestic violence against children and youth in Switzerland. This project raises awareness among young people about their rights and empowers them to address and prevent various forms of domestic violence. This includes corporal punishments, sibling or parental conflicts, gender violence and intimate violence partnerships with their peers and relatives. NCBI is a Swiss organisation focused on violence prevention, prejudice reduction and intercultural integration.

To provide core support to Liberty to promote and build support for human rights among the public and policy makers in the UK and ensure a rights-compliant Brexit. Liberty will also work to ensure that policy related to minorities rights and surveillance is developed and implemented in accordance with international human rights standards. Liberty will litigate, campaign and advocate in pursuit of these objectives.

To secure continuation of the Northern Ireland Sustainable Energy Programme for the next five years (2019 - 2024) and to ensure that 80 percent of the projected income from this programme (GBP 36million over five years) is dedicated to helping people living in fuel poverty. National Energy Action aims to reduce fuel poverty and advance education on energy conservation.

To eliminate housing discrimination and to ensure equal housing opportunity for all people in the US. This will be done through leadership, education, outreach, membership services, public policy initiatives, community development and advocacy. NFHA is a consortium of more than 220 private, non-profit fair housing organisations, state and local civil rights agencies and individuals. NFHA works to create diverse, barrier-free communities across the US.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To provide core support to the NHLP to limit the negative impact of current US federal housing policies through advocacy and strategic litigation. NHLP will also support the development of housing policies at the local level, which benefit low-income and vulnerable people. NHLP provides training and legal support to advocates throughout the US, to build capacity and influence.

To ensure equal justice for all in India by ensuring full respect for due process guarantees in the operation of the criminal justice system. This will be done by supporting the efforts of Project 39A, which is based at the National Law University, Delhi.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To provide core funding to NLIHC which works to achieve socially just public policy that assures people with the lowest incomes in the United States have affordable and decent homes. NLIHC educates, organises and advocates to preserve existing federally assisted homes and housing resources, expand the supply of low income housing, and establish housing stability as the primary purpose of federal low income housing policy.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To protect children from violence, including sexual violence, in Bulgaria. This will be achieved through a phased process of creating a movement to prevent violence against children, engaging key stakeholders and developing and implementing a nationwide strategy. The National Network for Children works to guarantee the rights of children and improve the wellbeing of Bulgarian families and children.

To provide core support to the National Network for Children in Bulgaria to implement its 2015-2020 strategy. The strategy aims to: (1) place the child and family in the centre of political and public life; (2) develop youth participation; and (3) further develop the network and increase the capacity of the members to influence national and local policies.

To develop the National Youth Advisory Council and provide training to a larger number of young homeless people to become youth advisors. This will enable them to influence policy more strategically and bring about change. NN4Y represents youth service organisations in the US that are dedicated to national advocacy efforts on behalf of runaway and homeless youth, as well as young people in high-risk situations.

Organisation: National St Johns Council for the Republic of Zimbabwe
Purpose: To continue training the public in first aid, home-based care and reproductive health in order to help people with HIV/AIDS. It is hoped that the project will help reduce cases of HIV infection. The National St Johns Council works to empower young people and adults living with, at risk of and affected by HIV.

To rebuild major elements of the Northern Bering Sea Climate Resilience Area by supporting advocacy in the US at state and federal levels through a public outreach campaign. The goals are to: permanently close the Northern Bering Sea to bottom trawling; to lower by catch limits for halibut; and to include traditional knowledge in the North Pacific Fisheries Management Council.

Organisation: Natural Resources Defense Council, Inc. - NRDC
Purpose: To assist the Chinese Government in implementing its ban on domestic elephant ivory sales and to reduce pressure on other illegally traded wildlife species including rhinos and pangolins. NRDC is an environmental action group that works to curb global warming, revive the worlds oceans and defend endangered wildlife.

To tackle illegal, unregulated and unreported fishing at a global level with a special focus on policy in Japan. Illegal, unreported and unregulated (IUU) fishing is a global problem that devastates marine ecosystems. By building strong partnerships between Japan, the EU, the US and the Pacific region, the Nature Conservancy aims to enhance the transparency of fisheries and strengthen the market for fish caught legally and sustainably. The Nature Conservancy works globally to protect land and water for nature and people.

To provide financial support to low-income people by reaching out to employers. This will be done by expanding, evaluating and disseminating lessons learned from Neighborhood Trust Financial Partners workplace financial empowerment programme, the Employer Solution. Neighborhood Trust works to empower low-income individuals to become productive participants in the US financial system and to achieve their financial goals.

To build Neighbors Togethers capacity to end hunger and poverty through its community action programme, Supportive Housing Advocacy Services. Neighbors Together is a soup kitchen and social service centre which seeks to end hunger and poverty in the Ocean Hill, Brownsville and Bedford-Stuyvesant areas of Brooklyn, New York City.

To support the work of the Four Freedoms Fund donor collaboratives, including grant-making, convening and strategising to build a more effective and connected US immigrant rights field. Participation will focus on the Funds Response to Harsh Enforcement Initiative, seeking to reduce the number of immigrants detained, deported and separated from their families, and to ensure enforcement policies and practices respect human rights and are accountable and fair.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To support the operation of Open for Business’s Local Influencer Programme in Kenya. Open for Business is a coalition of 26 of the worlds largest multinational corporations working to promote LGBT rights globally. Based in New York City, NEO Philanthropy is a funder intermediary with 30 years of experience helping not-for-profit organisations build movements for justice, equity and dignity.

To administer and strategically grow the Issues Affecting Women Programme's US-based trafficking and exploitation portfolio of grants. In addition to conducting due diligence and reporting on these grants, NEO will provide capacity building and networking support. NEO will also engage with new donors and mobilise additional resources for the anti-trafficking sector. In addition it will work to prevent and combat all forms of trafficking and exploitation via research, convenings and communications.

To provide core support to help implement the new 2017-2019 strategy of the Elevate Children Funders Group. In addition, this grant will contribute to a strategic collaboration through the Venture Fund and start up a Global Children's Policy Watch. A strategic partnership among donors will also be developed to ensure the protection of children on the move.

To support growth in Nest's Fellowship Programme, which matches mentors with hand workers and artisan businesses in developing countries to help them realise their potential, access the global marketplace and grow. Nest's mission is to help build a new hand worker economy to increase global workforce inclusivity, improve women's wellbeing beyond factories, and preserve important cultural traditions around the world.

To establish the Fund for Democracy and Solidarity in Europe and to support initiatives which strengthen civil society under threat. In addition this grant aims to promote the right of citizens to know and expose public sphere manipulation, and drive accountability in the online public sphere. NEF is an association of leading European foundations dedicated to strengthening philanthropic cooperation.

To enable the European Programme for Integration and Migration (EPIM) to support and strengthen civil society organisations active on migration and integration issues at the European level. Through grant-making, capacity building and convening, EPIM seeks to: uphold European commitments to human rights and social justice, ensuring the dignity of all people in the EU; promote principled, pragmatic approaches to EU-level and national policies on migration and integration; and influence EU policies and their national implementation.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To support the Evaluation Challenge Fund to research the prevention of violence against children in low-income countries and communicate these findings to people involved in policy design and programming for children. Those involved include international organisations, global networks, other funders and research institutions. NEF is an operational platform that seeks to develop joint initiatives between foundations and other actors.

To ensure that children in Bulgaria live with their families and communities. The Know How Centre on Alternative Care will further support the de-institutionalisation process in Bulgaria by building evidence and generating learning to be used by state institutions and all key stakeholders.
To increase the amount of good quality, low-cost housing in the UK. NEF is a UK people-powered think-tank partnering directly with communities to help them take control of their lives.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To provide core support to NEF and through them, to the New Economy Organisers Network (NEON). NEF partners directly with communities to help them take control of their lives, while also working to build systemic solutions for the future. NEON connects, focuses and builds the power of movements for social and economic justice.
To support New Philanthropy Capitals work to improve the effectiveness of the charitable sector, particularly in the UK, so that it can have the greatest possible impact on peoples lives and society.

To provide core support to New Schools Venture Fund for its work to catalyse innovation in school design to expand pathways to success for all students. This will be done through: innovative schools; education technology; and leaders from diverse backgrounds. The aim is to bring more relevant, innovative and sustainable solutions to the field.

To support NTC in identifying, piloting and evaluating the impact of teacher practices that support the academic and social-emotional success of students with learning differences. NTC will incorporate the most effective practices into their teacher and school leadership coaching products and services. This grant also provides match funding to NTC's Investing in Innovation grant from the US Federal Government.

To promote clean and efficient energy systems and policies which reduce pollution and improve health in Canada. The New Venture Fund provides philanthropists with an efficient, cost-effective and time-saving platform to design, launch and operate collaborative charitable projects.

To build a strong, diverse movement behind state-level adoption of progressive climate laws in the US to accelerate the uptake of electric vehicles. The New Venture Fund conducts public interest projects and provides professional insight and services to institutions and individuals seeking to foster change.

To support Funders for Housing and Opportunity (FHO), a new funders collaborative to improve the lives of more than 12 million renter households who pay more than half of their income on housing or who are homeless. FHO seeks to ensure that housing security is an essential part of efforts to improve family health, educational achievement, and economic mobility. FHO is a project of the New Venture Fund, a US based 501(c)(3) public charity.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To support the Sage Funds efforts to create in human rights accountability for economic actors by spurring innovation and building greater field capacity in the human rights movement. The New Venture Fund provides philanthropists with an efficient, cost-effective and time-saving platform to design, launch and operate collaborative charitable projects.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Purpose: To support the New Venture Fund to lead the Funders Collaborative for Innovative Measurement, whose mission is to create reliable social emotional learning measurement tools. These tools will be used for accountability, improvement and knowledge-building to support youth, including those with learning differences, to thrive and succeed. This project will allow for Oaks participation in the Funders Collaborative for Innovative Measurement.

To support national actions, especially from the global South, to implement the INSPIRE framework, which includes seven strategies that have shown success in reducing violence against children. The New Venture Fund provides philanthropists with an efficient, cost-effective and time-saving platform to design, launch and operate collaborative charitable projects.

To support the Global Partnership to End Violence Against Children and partners to advance the violence prevention movement. This grant also aims to pilot the End Violence Investors Forum to foster a new community of major international donors in support of the field.

To invest in communities most impacted by climate change so that they can manage the shocks, rebound and continue on a progressive pathway to sustainable development. The project is rooted in a social justice and human rights framework. It will prioritise the contributions and demands of women, youth and indigenous peoples to advance their adaptation and resilience to climate change. This will help influence national and inter-governmental financing mechanisms in ways that support 'bottom-up' community-led approaches. The New Venture Fund (NVF) works to achieve a healthier, more equitable world.

Organisation: New York City Joint Ownership Entity
Purpose: To provide a platform for the long-term preservation of affordable housing in New York City that will influence capital and pool resources to strengthen and support the not-for-profit housing sector. Joint Ownership Entity New York City is a newly-created not-for-profit organisation with this mission.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Organisation: New York Communities Organizing Fund, Inc
Purpose: To establish a coalition that strengthens the power of tenants to advocate for expanded protections for vulnerable tenants across New York State. New York Communities Organizing Fund, Inc. engages low-and moderate-income people in New York to support themselves through public education, advocacy, research and direct services.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To support NMNW to scale its rape prevention programme (called IM power) globally. This will be achieved by: training a core team of 12 people and launching IM power in Uganda; conducting an external impact evaluation on the Uganda pilot project; and building NMNWs institutional capacity.

To provide core support to the NWI to enable it to strengthen and support women's rights organisations around the world. NWI uses the prestige of the Noble Peace Laureates to increase visibility of women's organisations. NWI also builds the capacity of women and civil society organisations and connects them across movements to strengthen the power and impact of their advocacy.

To prevent the sexual abuse and sexual exploitation of children in six central and eastern European countries. The programme aims to: build capacity of professionals and parents; lobby local and central authorities for the obligatory introduction of child protection policy and standards in the education sector; and reduce societal tolerance towards the sexual exploitation of children.
Sub Programme: Ending the sexual exploitation of children

Purpose: To promote understanding and collaboration and to advance policies to ensure that each child in North Carolina is on track for lifelong reading success by the end of third grade. North Carolina Early Childhood Foundation is the lead organisation for the Campaign for Grade-Level Reading in the state. The Campaign is a collaborative effort by foundations, not-for-profit partners, business leaders, government agencies and communities.

To re-grant funds to small grass roots organising groups working on racial and social justice issues in New York City and the Hudson Valley. North Star Fund has been providing grants and support to new and small groups for 40 years using a participatory grant-making model.

Organisation: Nucleo de Apoio à Pesquisa e Educação Continuada
Purpose: To support Oak's Brazil Programme with staff and logistic support. Oak's Brazil Programme works to improve the lives of the most marginalised communities by promoting inclusive, efficient, democratic processes that operate in the best interests of all citizens of the Recife metropolitan area, irrespective of gender, age or socio-economic position.

To enable Nucleus Legal Advice Centre to provide housing, debt and legal advice services in West London. This will enable people to remain in their homes, appeal benefit decisions, resolve debt issues and challenge employers when needed (e.g., for unfair dismissal). The project will also work in two London boroughs to ensure the Homeless Reduction Act is effectively implemented.

To increase access to early intervention for deaf children and their families. Nzeve seeks to promote sign language and facilitate support to deaf children and their teachers as well as empower deaf youth to live independent, healthy lives. It also works to reduce discrimination against children with disabilities.

To provide core support to Oak Hill School so that it can continue to offer a half-day programme to students with diagnosed learning differences such as dyslexia and/or attention deficit disorders, who are struggling in mainstream classrooms in and around Geneva, Switzerland. The programme aims to remediate basic skills in reading, writing and mathematics in order for students to realise their potential. Students continue to attend their regular school for the remainder of their day, allowing them to participate in the mainstream curriculum, attend extra-curricular activities and maintain normal social interactions.

To increase the US Arctic's resilience in the face of climate change by preserving important safeguards that protect the region from renewed oil and gas exploration. This will be done by working to preserve the Northern Bering Sea Climate Resilience Area (NBSCRA); and advancing an adaptive, ecosystem-based approach to fishery management.

To engage citizens and businesses in coastal areas working in tourism, real estate, restaurants, sport fishing, diving and other healthy ocean-dependent sectors to improve the health of the US's oceans. Oceana Advocacy Resources promotes the design and implementation of policies at national and international levels to protect and restore marine fisheries, and to engage the public in marine ecosystem efforts.

To develop a campaign on single-use plastics in the US that targets major fast-moving consumer goods companies. This will be done by advocating directly with companies to make sustainability commitments that reduce the flow of single-use plastic pollution into the ocean.

To align the global energy transition with the goals set in the historic Paris agreement by ending public funding of fossil fuels and ensuring a fair and fast move towards clean power. Oil Change International is a research, communications and advocacy organisation that investigates financial and power relationships among governments, markets and the fossil fuel industry to facilitate the transition to a clean energy economy.

To prevent torture and ill-treatment by: strengthening legal frameworks that control the trade in torture technologies; increasing knowledge among governments and opinion shapers; and enhancing the ability of torture prevention bodies and civil society to monitor, document and report on torture and the technology used.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To provide core support to One25, which works to build supportive relationships with Bristol's street sex-workers through a person-centred approach. One25 reaches out to women trapped in, or vulnerable to, street sex work and supports them to break free and build new lives away from violence, poverty and addiction. It reaches around 290 women each year through night time outreach services and daytime drop-in services.

Organisation: Ontario College of Art and Design University
Purpose: To support OCADs Inclusive Design Research Centre to design a â€œSocial Justice Repair Kitâ€

To provide core support for Open Briefing; to establish new business areas including a security unit, a training unit, and the development and expansion of the existing intelligence unit; to provide up to eight subsidised assignments to IHRP grantees addressing security training and threat assessments. Open Briefing seeks to keep those striving to make the world a better place â€œsafe and informedâ€
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To support the 50.50 platform to raise awareness of critical women's rights issues, to provide tools that improve implementation of women's rights and to inform and influence global policy. By working with a geographically and thematically diverse constituency of authors, the platform aims to empower women, raise their profiles and increase the impact of their work. Oak support will also strengthen the platforms editorial capacities and improve its learning, monitoring and evaluation system.

To provide financial assistance for US military families, both active duty and veterans, facing crises. The Critical Assistance Program offers rent payment to avoid eviction, mortgage payments to avoid foreclosure, emergency food assistance, urgent home repairs, car repairs, medical/dental bills and utility bills. Operation Homefront builds strong, stable and secure military families so they can thrive in their communities.

To strengthen OMCT's communications and network capacity and increase the effectiveness, visibility and reach of its advocacy in the fight against torture. OMCT is a Geneva-based international network that aims to uphold the prohibition of torture by mobilising national and international support for the prevention of torture and the protection of victims of torture.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Purpose: To provide support to Orpigaq - a placement institution for young people in Kangerlussuaq in Greenland.
To provide core support to the Nossas (Our Cities) network, an online platform which promotes inclusive and sustainable cities across Brazil.

To provide support and recognition to children of deployed National Guard and Reserve service members and wounded veterans from all branches of service in the US. Our Military Kids provides athletic, fine arts and tutoring programmes to keep children of military families engaged in activities of their choice. This helps to relieve the stress of separation from the military parent by providing a positive distraction, minimising emotional destabilisation, building self-esteem and enabling academic achievement.

To advance development of LGBTI rights at the UN; to domesticate those gains at the national level; to pursue comprehensive capacity building of LGBTI groups in the Caribbean; to minimise violence directed towards those same Caribbean groups through training of police and law enforcement officials.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To support communities in 45 villages from Jharkhand, India to sustain their livelihoods. This will be done by increasing their access and control over forest resources and sustainable renewable energy solutions.
To provide support to Oxfam UK for its humanitarian emergency operations. Oxfam is an international confederation working with partners in over 90countries to end the injustices that cause poverty.
To provide up to 22 international-standard financial audits of International Human Rights Programme grantees in Russia.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To help establish US domestic and international shipping regulations that protect the Arctic marine environment and the subsistence practices of local indigenous communities. Pacific Environment partners with local people to solve environmental challenges in the Arctic and to ensure a fair transition to a clean energy future for all.

To provide conservation support and develop solutions which help sustain biodiversity, wilderness habitats and ecological processes through actions that benefit nature and communities. PAMS plays a key strategic role in halting the decline of the elephant population nationally in Tanzania, through an intelligence-led approach. This approach will also be used in Southern Africa (Mozambique and South Africa).

To provide core support to Pancreatic Cancer UK, supporting its investments in research and its work on data and intelligence to drive policy changes and improve treatment and care for patients with pancreatic cancer. Pancreatic Cancer UK is a charity in the UK fighting against pancreatic cancer by investing in research, supporting patients and advocating for change.
To support the establishment of a club â€œReady to startâ€

To mobilise and amplify influential parliamentary voices supporting the enactment of anti-discrimination legislation and the repeal of laws criminalising same-sex relationships. This grant will also support the ratification and domestic implementation of the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court and support the institutional development of Parliamentarians for Global Action.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To support a group of activists in Northern Ireland to achieve positive housing outcomes for individuals and to strengthen campaigns tackling the root causes of homelessness. Participation and Practice of Rights is committed to realising equality and socio-economic rights in Northern Ireland. Its work demonstrates that sustainable change happens when those directly affected are able to participate fully in creating solutions.

To reduce violence against children by improving primary prevention and increasing response efforts in households and at the community level in Zanzibar. Pathfinder aims to encourage gender equitable relationships, good parent-child communication around sexuality and violence, and public acknowledgement and condemnation of violence against children.

To empower vulnerable and marginalised young women and girls in Russia's North Caucasus through life skills courses. These courses build self-confidence, well-being, knowledge on health, rights, economic independence and personal development. The programme also builds a movement of strong women's civil society organisations by strengthening collaboration and technical specialisation of local women and youth organisations.

To provide Pennies with core support to help it continue to grow and provide an increasing amount of donations to the UK charity sector. Pennies provides a simple digitalised way for consumers to make modest donations to UK charities as part of their every day shopping experience.

To provide a robust “safety net” for human rights defenders and victims of human rights violations pursuing redress in Russian courts. This will be done by: emergency relocation; individual and group rehabilitation sessions; and advocacy work.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To move policymakers to recognise housing as a human right in the US and support the enactment of policies to reflect that. In addition, this grant aims to increase affordability, accessibility and safety of housing to meet current and projected needs. Peoples Action Institute was founded in 2016 to ignite a movement that captures the rising demand for change in US society.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Organisation: Philadelphia Association of Community Development Corporations
Purpose: To provide core support to PACDC, based in the US, to achieve the goals set out in its strategic plan. PACDC is dedicated to advocacy, policy development and technical assistance to enable Community Development Corporations and other organisations to rebuild communities and revitalise neighbourhoods in Philadelphia.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To provide legal services to more low-income residents in Philadelphia to empower them to overcome their criminal records and advocate for changes to simplify the record-clearing processes. Philadelphia Lawyers for Social Equity is an organisation that works with people who have had contact with the criminal justice system to find just outcomes.

To provide core support to Philadelphia VIP, a pro bono legal services agency providing free legal advocacy and representation to low-income people to prevent homelessness and preserve income. Philadelphia VIP works to promote equal justice for low-income people by providing civil legal services not otherwise available, collaborating with other legal services organisations, and promoting a culture of volunteerism by teaching attorneys and law students about poverty issues.

To support PHR to build a network of health care professionals for human rights, make medical and scientific voices heard through communications and advocacy, and sustain its work through larger and a more diverse base of supporters. Based in New York, PHR works at the intersection of medicine, science and law to end human suffering, save lives, and secure justice and universal human rights for all.

To increase the availability of affordable housing in New York City. Picture the Homeless seeks changes in city policies that enable the development of Community Land Trusts, which it aims to establish in at least three neighbourhoods in New York City. Community Land Trusts develop and steward affordable housing, community gardens, civic buildings, commercial spaces and other community assets on behalf of a community.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Purpose: To support 340 homeless people to move on from shelters into independent accommodation. Founded in 1969, Pine Street provides support to 9,000 homeless people every year.
Sub Programme: Increasing the supply of low-income housing

Organisation: Platform for International Cooperation on Undocumented Migrants
Purpose: To seek improvements in EU policy, legislation and national level practice, in regard to undocumented migrants. This is in particular related to alternatives to detention and non-detention of children, and includes changes in perceptions regarding the feasibility of mass deportations and the need to increase pathways to regularity. With a rights-based approach, PICUM drives evidence and expertise on undocumented migrants in Europe. It achieves this by leading an interdisciplinary network of practitioners, service-providers and undocumented migrants in trans-national exchanges, capacity building, research and policy engagement.
Sub Programme: Freedom from arbitrary detention and torture

Organisation: Positive Personal Skills in Society Foundation (Pernik)
Purpose: To test the Lucy Faithfull's â€œEradicating Child Sexual Abuse€

To develop a comprehensive approach to supporting homeless migrants in London by developing partnerships between the migrant and homelessness sectors. This includes the development of a London-wide service focused on preventing migrants from rough sleeping. Praxis Community Projects is committed to working with vulnerable migrants. It has a walk-in advice service and projects which seek to address the fundamental human rights of new migrants.

To support research and analysis that promote policies and programmes for sustainable, affordable access to modern energy supplies in India. This research will guide policy that promotes environmentally sustainable development.

To document the process and outcomes in six US cities in moving towards customised public education systems that address the needs of diverse learners. The Education Redesign Lab, housed at the Harvard Graduate School of Education, will examine how cities address the needs of students with learning differences, as well as those learning English and from diverse economic backgrounds. It will also document outcomes on a range of measures.

To challenge new forms of state surveillance, the transfer of surveillance capabilities across borders and the exploitation of data that threatens the security and safe operating of civil society. Privacy International generates awareness raising through investigative reports, policy papers, and recommendations for best practice in surveillance policies. It will investigate and document practices of the surveillance industry and exports of commercial surveillance technology globally. Privacy International is committed to fighting for the right to privacy around the world and prioritises capacity building of individuals and groups in the Global South.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To increase the resilience of small to medium sized UK Housing and Homelessness Programme grantees, as well as their ability to weather uncertain environments. This new capacity-building opportunity is a result of a partnership between Pro Bono Economics(PBE), Pilot light and the Cranfield Trust, all capacity building experts in the field. PBE harnesses the power of economics to help charities understand and improve their impact, using skilled volunteers.

To help end violence against children by promoting positive gender norms and the active engagement of men and boys in the Amhara Region of Ethiopia. This will be done via media campaigns and community mobilisation efforts which aim to shift negative gender norms that tolerate violence against children.
Sub Programme: Engaging men and boys in ending sexual abuse

Purpose: To reduce homelessness and poverty among families in the UK who are homeless or poor due to their immigration status. Project 17 also works to build the capacity of partner organisations to support immigrant families.

To enable Project HOME to build quality and capacity within its residential programmes to end and prevent homelessness in Philadelphia. Project HOME (which stands for Housing, Opportunities for Employment, Medical care, Education) achieves its mission through a continuum of services. These comprise street outreach, a range of supportive housing and comprehensive services designed for persons who have experienced homelessness.

To support Promundo's work to promote gender equality and create a world free from violence by engaging men and boys in partnership with women and girls. The focus of this grant will be to enhance Promundo's work in Europe and Eastern and Southern Africa and globally.

Organisation: Prospera International Network of Women's Funds
Purpose: To provide core support to Prospera International Network of Women's Funds, enabling it to continue strengthening the work of women's funds. As the global hub of women's funds, Prospera seeks to create opportunities for greater collaboration among its members and across sectors, develop technical skills and knowledge, and mobilise resources to strengthen and support women's funds to realise women's rights.

To build a safer environment for human rights defenders in Asia, Africa and Latin America by enhancing their security strategies where they are most at risk. PI implements comprehensive protection programmes, tailored to specific contexts, encompassing complementary strategies of capacity building, advocacy, research, publications and media tools. PI seeks to empower local defenders, increasing their capacity to manage their protection and security.
Sub Programme: Supporting and protecting human rights defenders

Purpose: To provide core support to Philanthropy Advancing Women's Human Rights (PAWHR. This donor affinity group seeks to advance women's human rights globally by mobilising funders to share knowledge, deepen networks and expand and drive resources. Oak support will also contribute to PAWHRs pooled fund to enable catalytic and collaborative grant-making opportunities among PAWHR members.

Organisation: Proteus Fund - International Human Rights Funders Group
Purpose: To provide core support to the Human Rights Funders Network (HRFN), a global network of over 1,550 grant-makers committed to advancing human rights through effective philanthropy. Based in New York, the HRFN works to foster collaboration and share learning between human rights funders; develop shared responses on policies and issues affecting the sector; and increase overall funding for human rights.

To provide diverse programmes and services while cultivating a nurturing community and caring homes in New York City. Providence House seeks to end the cycle of homelessness, abuse and return to incarceration by creating long-lasting change in the lives of women and families. This will be done through services provided in transitional shelters and permanent supportive housing.

To improve health and housing outcomes for homeless patients in East London through a personalised health and wellbeing programme that prevents rough sleeping. Providence Row is a charity which provides day services to homeless and vulnerable people.

To build the capacity of the Learning Differences Programme (LDP) and its partners in measuring the impact of Oak-funded work on students who learn differently. This will be done through the development and facilitation of an Impact Measurement Working Group. Public Impact will also provide research for the LDP to inform due diligence, strategic planning and learning.

To support PLP in its mission to improve access to public law remedies for those whose access to justice is restricted by poverty or some other form of disadvantage in the UK. Within this broad remit, PLP has adopted three main objectives: (1) increasing the accountability of public decision-makers; (2) enhancing the quality of public decision-making; and (3) improving access to justice.

To conduct independent investigations and engage in domestic and international litigation on cases of abuse and torture by law enforcement officers, as well as cases of violation of the rights to freedom of assembly, association and opinion in Russia. This grant will also support clients needing psychological and medical therapy, carry out a comprehensive monitoring of police and penitentiary system practices and conduct advocacy to put a spotlight on illegal practices.
Sub Programme: Ending impunity for gross human rights violations

Purpose: To accelerate the adoption and increase the ambition of climate solutions in Brazil. This will be done by creating and supporting networks, coalitions and public engagement campaigns in the country. The Purpose Climate Lab works to accelerate and build the ambition of climate solutions around the globe.
